characters: ROWLEY AND THE BIG WHEEL ARE KNOCKED OFF COURSE, HIT A CU
YOU WITH A BOOGER ON MY FINGER. HERE, I PUT IT ON THIS PA
WATCH THE KID ARC THROUGH THE AIR AND DISAPPEAR INSIDE TH
HE GRABS THE APPLE OFF THE FLOOR AND CHUNKS IT AS HARD AS
ROWLEY FLAT ON THE GROUND BEHIND THEM.
AROUND GREG, WHO REMAINS MOTIONLESS. THE SUN COMES OUT,
UP AND OVER THE CONFUSED KINDERGARTNERS TO FIND GREG AND
IN FAST MOTION, DIFFERENT GROUPS OF KIDS MOVE IN AND OUT
ROWLEY LEADS HIS MOM ONTO THE EMPTY DANCE FLOOR AND THEY
THE CARTOON BEGINS TO DRAW ITSELF AS GREG DOES THE VOICES
DRESSED AS A MEDIEVAL COURT JESTER, LAUGHING WEIRDLY AND

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Greg. GREG'S POV: we find RODRICK HEFFLEY, an insolent sixteen- year-old, in our face. Rodrick is dressed for school.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Greg!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (half asleep) What? Rodrick shakes Greg awake.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Get up, you’re going to be late. END POV to find GREG HEFFLEY in his twin bed. Greg is ele or twelve, average height, and really thin. Rodrick is go to town with the shaking thing, basically bouncing him on bed.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (fighting him off) Quit it, Rodrick! Why are you -- what am I late for?

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Middle school, what do you think? Today's your first day. Hurry up or Mom’s gonna lose it. Rodrick exits. Greg sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, now dressed and ready for school, eats cereal and r the comics with bleary eyes. He turns the kitchen TV on t AN INFOMERCIAL FOR A JUICER. He changes the channel, it’s INFOMERCIAL FOR BUYING FORECLOSURES. He keeps changing channels -- it’s all infomercials. Something’s not right. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 2.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Greg looks up. FRANK HEFFLEY, Greg’s dad, is there, weari a t-shirt and boxers. He mutes the TV.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Getting ready for my first day of middle... Greg trails off as he looks out a window. IT’S DARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the street we see the Greg’s house in the dar An owl perches on a tree limb in the foreground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Greg and Frank.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: .-.school.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It’s four o’clock in the morning. School doesn’t start until next week. SUSAN HEFFLEY, Greg’s mom, unhappily enters. She’s an attractive, harried mom. Frank watches MANNY, their wide- awake two-year-old son, scurry past her, grab the cereal and start eating out of it. FRANK (CONT’D) (sadly) You woke Manny up. He never goes back to sleep. (to Susan) He woke Manny up.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Have you lost your mind?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It was Rodrick!  DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 3. INT. RODRICK’S ROOM —- MOMENTS LATER They all stand in the doorway and look at Rodrick, sound asleep BUT NOW IN HIS PAJAMAS, snoring softly in his bed.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: But he --

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Go to bed. As they leave, Greg turns back to look at Rodrick, who is the same position only now he’s smiling.

dialogues.speaker: OPENING CREDITS
dialogues.text: Tight On a closed book. The cover reads ‘Diary’. Pull bac to reveal GREG HEFFLEY is holding the book and directly addressing the camera. Behind him is a WHITE BACKGROUND. Greg is a grown-up trapped in a kid’s body. He has a very matter of fact, casual manner about him -- a worldly, confident attitude. Even so, he remains a likeable boy because we know his bravura just masks normal insecurity. He’s Bill Murray as a kid.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Okay, first of all, let me get something straight: this is a JOURNAL, not a diary. (beat) Right, I know what it says on the cover, but when mom went out to buy this thing I TOLD her not to get me a book that said “diary” on it. This just proves Mom doesn’t know anything. If I walk into my first day of middle school carrying this book around, I might as well be wearing a sign that says “punch me”! INSERT SHOT: The cartoon drawing FROM THE BOOK of THE BUL DISCOVERING GREG'S DIARY. The drawing becomes animated: t Bully punches Greg, sending him and the “diary” flying.

dialogues.speaker: BULLY
dialogues.text: Wimp!  10 11 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 4. BACK ON GREG addressing the camera. 9

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: The only reason I agreed to write in this thing is because one day when I’m rich and famous I’1l have better things to do than answer peoples’ stupid questions all day long, and this book is gonna come in handy. INSERT SHOT: The cartoon drawing FROM THE BOOK of Greg at press conference. The drawing becomes animated as reporte shout questions at Greg.

dialogues.speaker: MALE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Gregory! Tell us about your childhood!

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Were you always so smart and handsome? Greg waves his journal at them.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Here's my journal. Now shoo, shoo. BACK TO GREG addressing the camera. 11

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I actually should have started keeping a diary -- I mean journal! -- years ago. Now there’s gonna be this big gap from birth to middle school. (beat) Anyway, I think future generations will be glad I kept a record of this time in my life, but the truth is when they make a movie or a TV mini-series about me, they’1ll probably just skip over the middle school years and go right to the part where I’m famous. (beat) Seriously, who’s gonna want to see a movie about a guy who’s stuck in middle school with a bunch of half- grown morons? He tosses the book on a nearby side table. ZOOM IN TIGHT THE BOOK AND HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: END OPENING CREDITS
dialogues.text: 12 13 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 5. INT. GREG’S BEDROOOM - MORNING 12 Still tight on the book, PULL BACK TO REVEAL the diary is Greg's bedside table, and he is asleep in the bed. SUPER: “September. Tuesday.” Susan, holding Manny, pokes her head in.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Get up, get up, it’s your first day of middle school! Greg stirs and opens his eyes. Suspicious, he checks the window for daylight to make sure it’s legit this time. It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, Rodrick, Manny, and Susan eat breakfast. Rodrick is working on a pile of flyers for his band Loded Diaper. Th flyers feature a picture of Rodrick and his bandmates holding instruments and trying their hardest not to look like suburban teenagers. Rodrick is adding devil horns to the “L” in Loded and chuckling.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mom's always saying I need to gain weight. But if you had to eat with my family, you wouldn’t have much of an appetite either. Pan around the table -- Susan picks her teeth, Rodrick ch his nails. Settle on Manny, who eats his cereal while sitting on a small training potty. Frank passes through o his way out to work, looks at Manny.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The toilet at the table, that doesn’t feel right.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I don’t want him to think it’s shameful.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It should be a little shameful. He grabs a piece of toast and kisses Susan.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: See you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 6.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He exits. 13

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: (to Greg) So, middle school. You nervous?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Nah.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Rodrick, give Greg some tips about middle school so he knows what to expect.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: (to Greg) It’s like prison. Don’t ever look anyone in the eye, but don’t look down either -- always be looking away, like you're lost in thought. He looks at Greg skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: I’m wasting my time, you'll be dead or home-schooled by the end of the year.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Not helpful, Rodrick.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: You're right. I’m sure he’1ll do great. He’1ll probably be Most Popular in the yearbook. Rodrick grabs his flyers, gets up to leave. He stops and turns around. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Oh, and one more thing...watch out for the cheese. Susan and Greg look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Okay, get Manny cleaned up and I’1l drive you to school. Manny looks at Greg, then dumps his cereal in his potty. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 14 15 16 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 7.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: He did that on purpose! I’m not cleaning it up.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: It’s your fault he’s still potty training.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, bored, perches on the vanity and watches Manny sit the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Don’t look down, Manny. The Potty Monster doesn’t like it when you look at him. Manny slowly looks down into the potty --

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (covers his mouth) Rrrhaaaaaarrrrrr! MANNY SCREAMS, jumps off the potty and runs out. END FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg chuckles to himself at the memory. Susan looks at hi sternly. Greg gets to work and unhappily dumps out the po into the sink. INT. SUSAN’S CAR - MORNING 16 SUPER: “First Day of School.” Susan stops in front of Whitmore Middle School in her old Honda. Greg looks out the window at students streaming inside. We see Susan wants badly for Greg to do okay here

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Want me to walk you in?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: No thanks. A beat; Greg just sits there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 17 18 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 8.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Are you going to get out?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah. He doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Do you want me to walk you in?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: No. Greg hops out. Susan watches him head toward the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s quiet as Greg nears the large metal front door. The school looks idyllic and nonthreatening. Next to the door a cartoon poster of a character named “Wacky Dawg” welcom new students.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Everybody's always saying how middle school is such a big deal. But to be honest with you, I wasn’t really sweating it all that much. He opens the door and is BLASTED BY A WALL OF NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg stands in the hallway. All around him is mayhem; it’ loud and packed with kids roughhousing and jostling and shrieking. Greg begins to walk down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, so I admit middle school was way different than what I was expecting. I mean, you got kids like me who haven't hit their growth spurt yet mixed in with these gorillas who need to shave twice a day. GREG'S POV: EXTREME CLOSE-UPS of one big kid’s BUSHY UPPE LIP FACIAL HAIR; another big kid’s FREAKISHLY HAIRY AND MUSCLED FOREARM; another big kid’s shirt open at the neck reveal A TUFT OF YET MORE HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And not just their faces. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 9.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A hulking boy with acne, PRESTON, catches Greg’s eye.

dialogues.speaker: PRESTON
dialogues.text: Hey, Greg.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Hey... Greg squints at him, puzzled; he has no idea who it is.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-fella.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Half of these kids were in my school last year, but I could hardly recognize them.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF PHOTOGRAPHS 19
dialogues.text: Side by side, we see before and after photos of several o Greg’s schoolmates. The “befores” are normal, cute grade school students. The “afters” look like bizarre hormone experiments. The first photo is of Preston, in which his clear grade school complexion becomes riddled with acne. the ones that follow, full shiny hair becomes lank and greasy; others are stuck in weird, awkward phases of thei growth spurts. In the last “before and after”, A SMALL, NORMAL-LOOKING KID HASN’T CHANGED AT ALL.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, so there were still a few normal looking people like me, but trust me, we were in the minority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg continues to move through the hall, three older guys approach him. The BIGGEST GUY steps in his path.

dialogues.speaker: BIGGEST GUY
dialogues.text: You new?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BIGGEST GUY
dialogues.text: Newbie! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 21 22 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 10.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He punches Greg hard in the arm, his buddies laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg rubs his arm at his homeroom desk as ROWLEY JEFFERSO enters behind a couple of other kids. Only his face is visible at this point.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (calls) Hey, Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Rowley Jefferson is my best friend. The two other kids part and we get our first good look at Rowley. The word for Rowley is “thick”. His head, neck, torso, and legs sit atop one another like a stack of bloc He has a heartbreakingly open, honest, sweet face. HE IS ALSO WEARING A BRIGHTLY COLORED SERAPE. Greg cringes when sees Rowley’s nerdy outerwear.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But that’s definitely subject to change. Rowley sees Greg and becomes excited, waving frantically.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (way too loud) Greg! Greg! Greg! As Rowley heads over to Greg, Greg notices some of the ot kids snickering at Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What are you wearing?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: We just got back from Guatemala. (with a flourish) It’s my serape! Greg slouches in his seat as Rowley spins to show it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, Rowley and the rest of the P.E. class wear gym clot Alarmed, Greg watches the large MUSCLED KID next to him s a ball from one hand to the other as COACH MALONE talks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 23 24 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 11.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Today you're going to learn how to play dodgeball right. First off, no aiming for the head.

dialogues.speaker: MUSCLED KID
dialogues.text: (raises his hand) What happens to us if we hit somebody in the head?

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Nothing. Okay now, listen up, when I blow the whistle that means... Coach Malone continues to talk as...

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Don’t ask me what genius came up with the idea of dodgeball. My parents spent a lot of money on my braces so I’m pretty sure they didn’t want me to get my teeth rearranged by some moron chucking a rubber ball at ninety miles an hour.

dialogues.speaker: LINE-DRAWN ANIMATION
dialogues.text: Greg gets hit in the mouth with a dodgeball thrown by a MORONIC GOON. His teeth fly everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg’s hand shoots up.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Uh, I have a heart murmur. My doctor says I can’t play dodgeball.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Okay, well...just go sit over there. He points to the edge of the sport court. Rowley watches Greg go and raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: I have...asthma.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Do you have an inhaler? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 12.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: An inhaler.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Where’s your inhaler?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: (sighs) Go sit next to the other guy. Rowley runs off and catches up to Greg. As they walk...

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: The people running this place are trying to kill us. Maybe this is how they’re gonna fix overcrowding in schools.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: I gotta get my hands on an inhaler. (points to dodgeball) ‘Cause that’s scary.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I’m not scared, I’m walking away to make a point. This is just barbaric.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Like the Roman gladiators. Greg and Rowley notice that ANGIE STEADMAN, an intense gi dressed all in black, has fallen in next to them.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gladiators were actually slaves that were forced to fight to the death just for people’s entertainment.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Really? Greg shoots Rowley a look that says “don’t engage”. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 13.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: I’m glad somebody around here finally sees the parallel. (then) I’m Angie. This is my second year, and I’m telling you, middle school is nothing but a bad joke. Through the following, Greg gets increasingly annoyed by Rowley’s attention to Angie.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And the crazy thing is, all the adults know it, but they keep it to themselves. I mean, you hear them talk all the time about how fun high school was and how cute they were in elementary school. But you never, ever hear them saying they wish they could be back in middle school. They never mention it at all.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (locked in) That’s true. Greg pulls Rowley away...

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (to Angie) I think the girls are supposed to be over there. As they move off...

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rowley, you gotta stay away from the nutsos. We’re projecting an image here, it’s a very delicate time. They continue toward an empty spot on the blacktop, looki over their shoulders at the dodgeball game. They watch CHIRAG GUPTA, a little Indian boy, get nailed by four bal at once. Greg turns away just in time to see AN OLD GROSS SLICE OF CHEESE right in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa. Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Is that...cheese? CLOSE ON THE CHEESE. FOREBODING MUSIC STING. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 14.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Greg squats down next to it. It’s a slice of cheddar, del cut. He reaches out with his finger, and is about to touc it --

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stop! Alarmed, Greg and Rowley turn to see Chirag run up, battl wounded and out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What, Chirag?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: You almost got the Cheese Touch.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: The what? Chirag takes a deep breath, and then begins speaking almo mystically...

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: A long time ago -- no one knows how long -- that cheese just appeared on the blacktop. No one ever threw it away, and so there it sat, growing more foul by the day. Then one day, a kid -- some say his name was Bernard -- made the biggest mistake of his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNARD, a curious kid, squats over the cheese and innoce touches it with his finger. Another kid (KID #1) sees him do it and points.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Bernard touched the cheese! Bernard touched the cheese! A crowd of kids runs over pointing and screaming as if th see a zombie.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: From that day on, Bernard had the Cheese Touch. END FLASHBACK.  26 27 28 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag continues his tale...

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: No one would go near Bernard because if they touched him, they would get the Cheese Touch. Bernard became an outcast. Until, that is, he was able to pass the Cheese Touch onto an unsuspecting foreign exchange student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIETER, a happy looking German foreign exchange student, talks to a group of kids. Bernard sneaks up to the edge o the circle and touches Dieter on the shoulder. The other kids recoil from a confused Dieter.

dialogues.speaker: DIETER
dialogues.text: Was soll das? One kid (KID #2) points at him in horror.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Cheese touch!

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And so it went, from student to student, from year to year. As Chirag speaks, we see a ROGUE’S GALLERY OF CHEESE TOUC VICTIMS through the years. Most are boys, but some are unhappy looking girls. END FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Greg and Rowley listen to Chirag...

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: The reign of terror ended when Abe Hall got it five years ago. He moved to California and took the Cheese Touch with him.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK TO
dialogues.text: 29 30 31 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of solemn kids watch a station wagon pull away. W see ABE, a haunted looking boy, peering out the back wind his hands pressing against the glass. END FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag looks at them dolefully.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: And so today, the cheese sits, patiently waiting for a new victim.

dialogues.speaker: GREG/ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (blown away) Wow.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: This is a terrible place. Greg and Rowley look at the cheese. When they look up, CHIRAG IS GONE. Coach Malone blows his whistle, signallin the end of P.E.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just throw it away. Rowley starts to reach for the cheese -- Greg quickly hol him back.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Geez, Rowley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cafeteria is just as loud and untamed as the rest of school -- there’s yelling, pushing, maybe some food flyin places. Greg and Rowley move through the lunch line, push their trays.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: By the way, second floor bathroom? No stall doors. I learned that the hard way.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: What? If there’s no doors people can see you. And all your business. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 31 32 33 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 17.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, worse than them seeing you is you seeing them. Trust me, you don’t want to lock eyes with some strange guy sitting on a toilet. It’s a weird feeling. Rowley shudders. The lunch lady hands Greg a plate of yellow, lumpy goop (chicken a la king). He and Rowley hea toward the table area. They see a few empty seats at a table of kids. Greg start to put his tray down.

dialogues.speaker: LUNCH KID
dialogues.text: That seat’s saved.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: For who?

dialogues.speaker: LUNCH KID
dialogues.text: It’s saved. Greg moves toward another empty seat at the table.

dialogues.speaker: LUNCH KID
dialogues.text: That seat’s saved. Greg moves to the last empty seat. He looks at the kid wh just shakes his head. Greg looks around at the others at table; they ignore him and Rowley as if they don’t exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg decides to try his luck with some shaggy looking skateboard kids. He crosses to their table, but they take one look at him and Rowley:

dialogues.speaker: SKATE KID
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley approach a table full of girls.

dialogues.speaker: HAUGHTY GIRL
dialogues.text: Forget it. Rowley turns to Greg.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: So where are we supposed to eat?  34 35 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley have found a couple of lonely chairs in t corner and awkwardly try to eat with their lunch trays on their laps. FREGLEY, a thin hyper kid who breathes throug his teeth in a way that often makes a whistling sound, approaches with a lunch tray.

dialogues.speaker: FREGLEY
dialogues.text: Hey Greg Heffley. Want to see my secret freckle?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: No thanks, Fregley. Fregley sits down on the floor next to them. Greg tries t cut his chicken, but without a table it’s hard to do and chicken goes flying off of his plate and plops on the flo near Fregley. They all look at it.

dialogues.speaker: FREGLEY
dialogues.text: Are you going to finish that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids stream out at the end of the school day. Greg and Rowley are mid-pack.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, the first day wasn’t great, but at least I got out with my dignity. Or so I thought.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (yelling to be heard) Hey Greg, you want to come over and plaayyy?! An older kid, QUENTIN, overhears and steps in front of th

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (panicked) ...Flarb.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (to Greg) What'd he say? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 35 36 37 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 19.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I don’t even know that guy.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (calls to friends) Hey guys, check it out. Quentin’s two buddies, ARTHUR and JOE, approach.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: This guy says to that guy, want to come over and plaayyy? Greg grimaces at Quentin and his friends’ scornful expressions.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This was hard to take, because in twenty years all these mouth-breathers would be working for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s Greg, the same actor, but with a mustache and wearin short sleeve dress shirt with a tie. He holds a clipboard and watches Quentin, Joe, and Arthur (also with mustaches struggle mightily to put a heavy crate on a high shelf.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: We finally got it up there, boss.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: That’s a shame. Because now I need you to take it back down, and after that I’m going to need you to put it back up there.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Chop chop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WHOLE CROWD OF KIDS are now gathered around Greg and Ro as Quentin finishes gleefully repeating the story for newcomers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 20.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: (mocking) «..come over and...plaayyy! THEY ALL LAUGH. Greg grabs Rowley and quickly pulls him a from the crowd to a space by the bike rack.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: What? What’d I do?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: We're in middle school now. Nobody plays anymore, they hang out.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: What’s the difference?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: The difference is we can’t act like kids anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay, got it. ROWLEY NONCHALANTLY GRABS HIS BIG WHEEL which is parked n to a bunch of bikes. Greg looks at the Big Wheel in horro

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Rowley. A Big Wheel?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) I like being low to the ground. Rowley takes off on his Big Wheel. Greg follows, consciou of the stares Rowley is attracting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodrick’s van with the name of his band “Loded Diper” scrawled on the side is parked in the driveway. Next to t van is parked Rowley’s Big Wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley sit on the floor and play a racing video game. Manny sits on his tiny potty next to them and watch Rowley is engrossed in the game, but Greg is clearly distracted. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 21.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When we got home I tried to unwind, but I couldn’t stop thinking about school. And I’m worried about Rowley. He’1l never be able to figure out how to make it through that place. He lacks nuance. I mean, you can beat him at a video game just by naming your car something ridiculous. On the TV, Greg’s car passes Rowley’s.

dialogues.speaker: ROBOT VIDEO GAME VOICE
dialogues.text: Bad Fart ahead!

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (falls over laughing) Bwaahahaha! In imitation, Manny laughs and falls off his potty.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s race again. Greg switches off the game. Rowley looks at him questioningly. Manny mimics Rowley and also looks at Greg questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Rowley, you need to focus. Our first day sucked.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: It did? Greg looks at Rowley like, “Is anybody home?”

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: We’re nobodies at school. I don’t know about you, but I never envisioned myself as the guy who has to eat lunch off his lap. That is okay for Fregley but not me.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: My mom told me to just be myself and people would like me.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: That would be good advice if you were somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK TO
dialogues.text: 40 4l DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg opens the front door to Rowley, who consults a book ("How to Make Friends in New Places with Jokes”).

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Knock knock!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Thermos!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Thermos be some way to tickle your funny bone!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Say what? END FLASHBACK. INT. HEFFLEY LIVING ROOM —- CONTINUOUS 4l Greg gives Rowley a sideways look. Rowley gets an idea an looks excited. Manny looks excited, too.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: I think I may still have that joke book I used when I met you. Maybe I should bring it to school? Greg looks at Rowley sorrowfully.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: That book is not your friend. No book is going to help us. A beat while Rowley and Greg think. Rowley screws up his face in concentration and stares at the ceiling. Manny imitates him. Greg gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to get into Rodrick’s room.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: I’m not going in Rodrick’s room. Rowley shakes his head “no”. So does Manny.  42 43 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUD TERRIBLE MUSIC. Greg and Rowley peek around the corn to see Rodrick play the drums as he rehearses with his cr band. They wince at the noise. INT. RODRICK’S ROOM —- MOMENTS LATER 43 Rodrick’s room is a mess. Posters indicate he’s really in Nine Inch Nails, Tool, and Slipknot. Rowley watches the d nervously as Greg, on his hands and knees, tosses aside j from underneath Rodrick’s bed. A half-eaten candy bar; a ouija board; and A GLOSSY MAGAZINE ENTITLED “MOTO MAMAS”, cover of which features a very buxom model in a thong bik draped promiscuously over a motorcycle. Rowley eyes widen he looks at the magazine.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Wow. I didn’t know Rodrick was into motorcycles. Greg pulls out the WHITMORE MIDDLE SCHOOL YEARBOOK, holds up.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Rodrick’s middle school yearbook. He quickly pages through, finds what he’s looking for.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Right here, Class Favorites. The best in the class. These people are famous. And I guarantee you they always get an actual table at lunch. As Greg looks through the Class Favorites, we go CLOSE ON PICTURES.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This was it. If you can get yourself voted onto the Class Favorites page, you're practically an immortal. Even if you don’t live up to what you get picked for, it doesn’t really matter because it’s on permanent record. Settle on the photo of the “Most Popular” guy, BILL WATSO (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 44 45 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 24.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: People still treat Bill Watson like he’s something special even though he dropped out of high school and works at the Food Barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Susan are at the grocery store checkout behind T HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS. An older-looking Bill Watson is the bagger. The girls eye Bill and giggle.

dialogues.speaker: BILL WATSON
dialogues.text: Will that be paper or plastic?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH SCHOOL GIRL
dialogues.text: (dreamy ) Whatever you think, Bill. END FLASHBACK. INT. RODRICK’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS 45 Greg points Favorites from the book out to Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: This is where I need to be. Most Popular, Best Dressed, Class Clown...they should just give that to me right now. I’m hilarious. Rowley notices the picture of the “Cutest Couple”.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, maybe we should go for “Cutest Friends”.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right? THE DOOR FLIES OPEN. IT’S RODRICK.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: What did I tell you I’d do to you if I caught you in my room again?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: You said you’d kill him.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Good answer, Rowley. You can go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 46 47 48 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 25.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rowley sprints out.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Greg!

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Mom and Dad aren’t here. It’s just you and me. And I’m going to really, actually kill you. Greg makes a break for the door. He feints left, then hea right, but Rodrick stays with him blocking the door. Greg jumps up on Rodrick’s bed and grabs the edge of Rodrick’s prized Nine Inch Nails poster and prepares to rip it.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! Greg starts to rip it; Rodrick lunges for him. Greg jumps around him and runs out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Rodrick right on his tail, Greg squeaks into his roo He shuts and locks the door behind him, leaving an enrage Rodrick in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodrick beats on the door.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You can’t stay in there forever, Greg! I don’t care how long it takes, I’m going to be right here, waiting to kill you! Greg peeks under his door. FROM GREG’S POV we see Rodrick sneakers. Greg sighs. INT. GREG’S BEDROOM - LATER 48 Greg creeps to the door, peeks underneath it. FROM GREG’S POV we see Rodrick’s sneakers are still there. BAM BAM BA Rodrick bangs on the door. Greg jumps back.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Rodrick, time out, I have to pee.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No time outs!  49 50 51 52 53 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 26. INT. GREG’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 49 Night has fallen outside Greg’s window. Greg peeks under door; RODRICK’S SNEAKERS ARE STILL THERE. Greg hops from foot to the other; he really has to pee. Desperate, he puts his hand on the doorknob. Takes it off Puts it back on, takes a breath, flings open the door and assumes a fighting stance... But the hallway is empty. What? Greg looks down, revealin RODRICK’S EMPTY SNEAKERS. Greg speeds off to the bathroom INT. BATHROOM —- MOMENTS LATER 50 Greg stands over the toilet and starts to go. Suddenly, Rodrick leaps out from behind the shower curtain.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Raaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhh! !!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhh!!! Startled, Greg jumps and twists and WE HEAR THE SOUND OF SPLASHING EVERYWHERE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg scrubs the bathroom floor around the toilet. Susan stands over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s dark. Time speeds up, the sun rises, revealing the cheese. A little steam comes off it as the day begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley examine the Activity Board that is posted a cork wall. There’s a heading for each activity (Key Clu Swim Team, etc.) with a sign-up sheet underneath. Angie walks up behind them and listens.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: You don’t like any of this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I know, but if I’m gonna be a Class Favorite I have to make a name for myself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 27.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: Why do you want to be a Class Favorite? Startled, Greg turns around to her.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I didn’t say that.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, you did.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: No, I...what probably happened is somebody yelled it over there and the sound bounced off this wall behind me so it sounded like I said it.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: I’ve seen that on Scooby Doo. A beat. Angie looks at them, trying to decide if they’re kidding. She forges ahead.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Well, you should sign up for the school paper. We're the voice of the people -- well, the people are mostly idiots, so I guess technically we're the voice of the people making fun of the people.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I can’t be on the paper because I’m going to be in the paper a lot, so that would be a conflict of interest. Angie realizes Greg is not the fellow iconoclast she thou he was.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: Ohh. You’re the people. Got it. Angie walks off as PATTY FARRELL, a tall and aggressive g muscles Greg and Rowley out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: Outta my way, dweebs. (then) Oh. Hello, Greg. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 28.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Patty. Patty haughtily turns to the activity board, signs up for something, and crosses off.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Man, if I knew Patty Farrell was going to Whitmore, I’d have begged Mom and Dad to send me to private school. She's been a problem since kindergarten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Patty sit with the rest of the class in front of their KINDERGARTEN TEACHER.

dialogues.speaker: KINDERGARTEN TEACHER
dialogues.text: Can any of you tell me why Peter Rabbit went into Mr. McGregor’s garden? Patty’s hand shoots up. KINDERGARTEN TEACHER (CONT’D) Yes, Patty?

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: Was it because Greg Heffley smells weird? Everyone laughs; Greg looks pained. END FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuming, Greg watches Patty sashay down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (re: activity board) Hey, they got wrestling this year.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What? Greg looks at the activity board and locks onto the words “Boys Wrestling”.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 56 57 58 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT IN BLACK AND WHITE -- RAGING BULL STYLE. Flashbulbs popping, crowds of kids screaming around the ring. Greg, a flamboyant pro wrestling costume, finishes off a large Hogan-type opponent. A REFEREE raises Greg’s hand in victory.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE
dialogues.text: Greg Heffley wins everything! The crowd goes wild in a blinding blaze of flashbulbs. FREEZE ON GREG. The image morphs into a picture.

dialogues.speaker: AN OPEN YEARBOOK
dialogues.text: We see Greg’s wrestling picture. The caption underneath reads “Most Athletic”.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. GYM — DAY 58 A line of kids, including Greg and Rowley, shiver and shy try to cover their personal parts in their WRESTLING SINGLETS. The only kid who does not seem self- conscious Fregley. They watch Coach Malone and his helper, COACH HARPER, demonstrate wrestling holds on the mat. The coaches move into a standing clinch, which means they’re holding each other very close.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Okay gang, this is known as a clinch. Greg winces; this isn’t what he signed up for. He raises hand. COACH MALONE (CONT’D) What is it, Heart Murmur?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: When are we going to learn Pile Drivers and Body Slams?

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Pile Drivers and Body Slams are TV wrestling. It’s fake. Kind of like your heart murmur.  59 60 61 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 30. INT. GYM — DAY 59 The kids are lined up in three groups in front of three m We can’t tell who’s in what group because of camera angle

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Okay, we've divided you up into weight classes. (points at group of big kids) Rottweilers, you’re on mat one... (points at Rowley’s medium group) Bulldogs, you’re on mat two... Reveal Greg and Fregley in their own group of two. COACH MALONE (CONT’D) And Chihuahuas. Let’s see you two try a clinch. Greg looks at Fregley who whistle-breathes with excitemen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Fregley face off on the mat.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I couldn't believe they were making me wrestle a little guy like Fregley. I just hoped I didn’t hurt him too bad. Coach Malone blows the whistle. Greg and Fregley go into clinch. FREGLEY IMMEDIATELY PINS GREG. Coach Malone blows the whistle again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley (who is pushing his Big Wheel by the handlebar) walk up a rather steep street. Greg, looking annoyed, tosses a football up in the air. As they go...

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, you know, Fregley’s just really good.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: He’s not good, he got lucky. I wasn’t even trying. Greg stops walking, Rowley continues to the top of the hi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 62 63 64 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 31.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Next time I won’t go so easy on him. (then) You ready? Rowley points his Big Wheel down the hill and gets on.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Ready. Rowley takes off down the hill as fast as he can. As he goes, Greg takes aim. Rowley, keeping an eye on Greg, pedals furiously to avoid getting hit. Greg fires the football at him. Rowley swerves to the right to avoid the ball. Greg misses high and THE BALL SAILS OVER ROWLEY AND KNOCKS A MAILBOX OFF ITS POST. Greg looks around -- the HOMEOWNER OPENS HIS FRONT DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: HOMEOWNER
dialogues.text: Hey! Greg takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (yells at Rowley) Go, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrestling practice. Greg steps onto the mat and faces Fregley. This time he’s determined he’s going to show thi kid who’s boss. Coach Malone blows the whistle. Greg and Fregley circle each other. Then Fregley charges Greg, kno him to the ground and pins him.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: (to Greg) Keep at it, you’ll get ‘em next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the mat. Fregley immediately pins Greg. Coach Malone blows the whistle.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: (to Greg) That's okay, next week is your week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fregley pins Greg; this time he’s sitting on Greg’s face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 64 65 66 67 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 32.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Blow the whistle, blow the whistle! The coach does. Greg looks to him for encouragement.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got nothin’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE CHEESE as dead leaves blow over it.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So Fregley’s clearly on steroids or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “Halloween.” Greg trudges home past houses decorated for Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Problem is, nobody ever got Class Favorite getting his butt kicked by a guy like Fregley. Suddenly, Rowley -- dressed in an impressively realistic “Knight” costume -- jumps out from behind a bush to start Greg.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: En Garde!

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lucky for me, it’s Halloween. Rowley proudly models his costume.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Huh? What do you think? INT. GREG’S BEDROOM - EVENING 67 Greg, in his PIRATE COSTUME, writes in his journal.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I figure all I have to do is pig out on the candy I get and I’11l bulk up enough to get out of Fregley’s weight class. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 67 68 69 70 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 33.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I just have to make sure I get a ton of candy -- I’ve got no time to screw around at a haunted house like last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, Rowley and Susan enter a dark room. They walk a bit SUDDENLY, THE EAR-SPLITTING SOUND OF A CHAINSAW. The room bathed in red light, revealing a HUGE BLOOD-SOAKED GUY IN HOCKEY MASK REVVING A REAL CHAINSAW. On the ground is a BLOODY CORPSE whose arms have been chainsawed off. The Chainsaw Killer takes a run at Greg and Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: GREG/ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaahhhhhhhhh! !!! Just as CHAINSAW KILLER reaches Greg and Rowley, Susan st in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Turn that off! Turn it off right now! Chainsaw Killer does.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: That is not very nice.

dialogues.speaker: CHAINSAW KILLER
dialogues.text: (chagrined teenage voice) I’m sorry, ma’am. The Corpse gets up to see what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: (to both of them) You should be ashamed of yourselves. END FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell rings. Excited, Greg runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg answers the door. Rowley stands there, his Knight costume rendered completely uncool by orange reflective safety gear, including a safety flag tied to his belt. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 34.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What happened to your costume?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: My mom wanted me to be visible at night. Greg sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg shows Rowley a hand-drawn map of their route.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: -..So we'll hit a few houses on the way to the North Side, which is where we'll do most of our trick or treating.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Why are we going all the way over there?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It’s where the rich people live and I need maximum candy to get out of the Chihuahuas. Rodrick enters in full goth rock and roll mode. He’s wear eyeliner.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You look pretty.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Shut up, tool. lLoded Diper’s got a gig tonight. Rodrick snatches the map out of Greg’s hands. RODRICK (CONT’D) Going to the North Side, huh? Takes you right past the Devil Worshiper Woods. (off Greg and Rowley) You know that story, right? Greg and Rowley shake their heads “no”. Rodrick leans ove them, very serious. RODRICK (CONT’D) Well, there used to be a house... (points to map) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 72 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RODRICK (CONT’D) ...right here where these woods are. But a long time ago, two kids who were, I don't know, maybe in middle school, trick or treated that house on Halloween night. But the house was full of devil worshipers who stuck the kids in giant ovens and cooked them and ate them. But they forgot to turn off the ovens and the house burned down with everyone in it. So the neighbors buried what was left and swore nobody would ever live there again. Greg and Rowley’s eyes are as big as saucers.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: How'd the trees get there?

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: (same forboding tone) And then they planted trees.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: And to this day, on Halloween night, you can hear the unearthly laughter of the devil worshiper ghosts as they roam the woods looking for more kids to eat. Unseen by Rodrick, Frank has entered and heard.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Real nice, Rodrick. Rodrick turns around.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pained) Are you wearing eyeliner?
71 72 Greg and Rowley are at the door, adjusting their costumes Manny (dressed as a pumpkin), enters with Susan and Frank

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Greg, Manny wants to go with you. Manny runs up to Greg. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 73 74 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: Bubby!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Mom, I told you to make him stop calling me that, what if somebody hears?

dialogues.speaker: LINE-DRAWN ANIMATION
dialogues.text: Greg comes out of school with a crowd of kids. Manny wait for him.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: Hi, Bubby! All the kids around Greg point and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Then they’11 know how much he loves you.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I can’t take him, we're going to the North Side.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Over by Gramma’s house? No, it’s too far. Frank, go with them.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sorry, I can’t. I have plans. Susan looks at him suspiciously, then:

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: No. No way. You are not sitting in the bushes all night this year so you can dump water on teenagers.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: But they always TP our house.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Because you dump water on them! Draft 36. 72

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 73 Susan and

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 74 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 75 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 37.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Because they TP us.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Because you -- you’re not doing it again. I’m still getting dirty looks from Sean Simmon’s mother. Greg laughs, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: He was really mad.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (fond memory) I totally nailed him. (off Susan’s look) It’s my favorite part of Halloween. Susan is unmoved. EXT. GREG’S STREET - NIGHT 75 Greg, Rowley, Manny and Frank stop in front of a house wi jack-o-lantern on the front step.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You want to give this house a try, Manny? They start to head up the walk, but Manny sees the jack-o lantern. HE SCREAMS BLOODY MURDER until they retreat a fe steps.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Come on, Manny, it’s just a pumpkin. Look, you're a pumpkin. Manny looks down at his costume and realizes that’s true. SCREAMS AGAIN. They move away and Manny settles down, although periodically he glances at his costume, reminds himself he’s a pumpkin, and makes a startled squawk.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay, I think that’s about it. Time to go home.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: But we’ve only been to three houses. (waves his almost empty candy bag) I...only...have...THREE PIECES OF

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 76 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 38.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (uncharacteristically angry) Three!!!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: All right, all right. You guys can go on your own. But stay in the neighborhood. No North Side, okay?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I promise. They watch Frank and Manny head home. As soon as they’re of sight, Greg and Rowley take off running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley leave a house, their bags bulging with ca

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: That guy gave me a full size Snickers.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah, these people got money to burn. Just then, A PICKUP ROLLS UP ON THEM. Two high school kid (CARTER and PETE) are in the cab, with two more (CHRIS an WADE) in the pickup bed. Greg and Rowley watch as the pic slows to a crawl in front of them. WADE PRODUCES A FIRE EXTINGUISHER AND SPRAYS THEM.

dialogues.speaker: GREG/ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Aaaaahhhhhh! Rowley raises his knight shield and manages to block most it. The pickup speeds off. Greg steps out into the street

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: We're calling the cops! Brake lights.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Reverse lights.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Oh boy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 76 77 78 79 80 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 39.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The pickup speeds back towards them. Greg and Rowley take off down the street, but the pickup gives chase. Greg tak a left into a driveway.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: This way. EXT. SOMEONE’S BACKYARD - NIGHT 77 As Greg and Rowley climb a fence...

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Where’re we going? They get over the fence and run down a driveway to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the next block. There’s the truck. They take off down the street, the pickup closing in, the teens inside whoop and hollering. As they approach a house...

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: This is it. The pickup stops in front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You guys are dead! Greg and Rowley run to the front door as the teens bail o of the truck. EXT. GRAMMA’S HOUSE - NIGHT 79 Rowley watches Greg search under the welcome mat.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Whose house is this?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: My Gramma’s. She’s out of town. Greg finds the key, unlocks the door and they run in the house with seconds to spare. INT. GRAMMA’S HOUSE - NIGHT 80 Breathing heavily, Greg and Rowley creep around to the li room window and peek outside. The four teens, their faces pressed against the window, look right back at them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (yells through glass) What’re you gonna do, get your mommy?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (yells back) We can’t, it’s not our house, it’s his gramma’s and she’s not even home. Greg stares at Rowley in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What -- why would you tell them that?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Oops. 81 INT. GRAMMA’S HOUSE - NIGHT 40. 80 81 It’s later, and Greg and Rowley have left the house dark. They peek out the window again. The teens lean against th pickup and watch the house; they show no signs of leaving

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: You need to call your mom to come get us.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Great idea. “Hey Mom, can you come pick us up on the North Side where you told us not to go? Oh, and by the way, we broke into Gramma’s house, so that’s where we’ll be.” You call your mom.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: I better not. She already thinks you're a bad influence. (big smile) And she’s right. Greg looks outside at the teens.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: We're going to have to bust out of here.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: How?  82 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 4l. EXT. GRAMMA’S HOUSE - NIGHT 82 The teens hang out by their pickup watching the house. A LOUD WHIRRING SOUND comes from the garage. They walk over look.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Over here. GRAMMA’S GARAGE DOOR SLOWLY OPENS AND REVEALS GREG AND RO AS SILHOUETTES BACKLIT BY THE GARAGE LIGHT. Greg holds a WEED WHACKER and Rowley holds a LEAF BLOWER. The door thu fully open and Rowley and Greg fire up their garden implements. THE MOTORS SCREAM as Rowley and Greg run/stum under the weight of them toward the teens. The teens laugh at first, but they begin to back off as t leaf blower blows dirt and leaves into their eyes and Gre waves the heavy weed whacker (over which he has little control) at them. They reach the pickup.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: You better leave us alone unless you want a taste of this. He jabs the weed whacker at them to make his point, but l control a little and PUTS A GASH IN THE FENDER of the pic

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?! Pete makes a move toward Greg. Greg squeezes the trigger the weed whacker too fast and floods the engine. IT SPUTT AND DIES. As Greg frantically tries to restart it...

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna rip your arms off and then punch you in the face with your own fists. Rowley provides cover with the leaf blower as he and Greg slowly back away.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: There’s no place left to go.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: There’s one place. He points to the woods. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 83 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 42.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: The Devil Worshiper woods? The teens are getting too close.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Run! They drop the machines and hightail it toward the woods.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: They're going into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m not going in there.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (calls after them) This isn’t over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CUE: “Run Through the Jungle” by CCR. All is shot shaky hand-held style, in greenish night visi Greg and Rowley race through the woods, tripping and yell in fear every time a tree branch or bush grazes them. The stop to catch their breath, both of them breathing heavil

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Which way?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: We just keep running, Rowley. Suddenly, a STRANGE, HIGH-PITCHED UNEARTHLY LAUGHTER FILL THE WOODS. They look around frantically for the source, t shaky cameras mimicking their moves, then look at each ot scared beyond belief.

dialogues.speaker: GREG/ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaahhhhhh!!! They run off. A beat as we stay on the patch of woods they've left. Then, movement. First, a strange, bobbing head. It looks like...a child in costume? IT’S FREGLEY,

dialogues.speaker: DRESSED AS A MEDIEVAL COURT JESTER, LAUGHING WEIRDLY AND
dialogues.text: CLUTCHING A PILLOWCASE FULL OF CANDY. He skips happily through the frame.  84 85 86 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted, Greg and Rowley finally stop running when they reach the sidewalk in front of Greg’s house.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Are we safe?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah. And we made it with all our candy. They high five. SUDDENLY THEY ARE SOAKED IN WATER. They look up to see Frank standing there with an empty trashca

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (stifles a laugh) Sorry. I didn’t know it was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “November. Sunday.” Susan and Greg are driving. They pass by Gramma’s house a see that it has been extensively and thoroughly TP’ed. Su and Greg stare at it in shock.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, look at that. What would make them pick Gramma’s house?

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I kept my mouth shut. I did feel a little bad, because it looked like it was gonna take a long time to clean up. But on the bright side, Gramma is retired so she probably didn’t have anything planned for today anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley (pushing his Big Wheel) walk up the same steep street like before. Greg has his football tucked un his arm and is attempting to unwrap a wet candy bar.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: How is it?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Gross. But it’s worth it. I just need to gain one more pound before wrestling practice. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 44,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rowley shakes his head admiringly.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Gosh, you get to eat all that chocolate. I almost wish I was as bad a wrestler as you.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Top of the hill, Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rowley comes screaming down the hill on the Big Wheel. Gr cocks his arm and fires the football at him. The ball goe wide and nails a parked car, putting a dent in the door. CAR ALARM GOES OFF.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (to Rowley) Go, go! Greg grabs the football, takes a frightened look around, takes off running. 88 INT. GYM — DAY 88 Greg and Rowley are in their singlets waiting to weigh in Coach Malone. Greg is eating another gross wet candy bar. They see BRYCE ANDERSON -- a cool kid in a basketball uni -- talking to two cute girls in cheerleading outfits (SHE and MARLY).

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Girls really like Bryce Anderson.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah. Get this, apparently it’s because Bryce has a “cute butt”.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: A cute butt? But it’s a butt.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I know, but I heard Shelly say it. And it was definitely a good thing. Rowley chews over what Greg just said.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Jeez. Greg, looking nauseous, stuffs the last of a candy bar in his mouth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 89 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 45.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ready? Greg burps then sighs.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah. Greg steps onto the scale.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Heffley, you moved up to Bulldogs. And here’s your new wrestling partner. Coach Malone points off. Greg looks to see Patty Farrell a singlet striding toward the mats.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What? But this is boy’s wrestling.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: Ever hear of Title Nine?

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Her parents threatened to sue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg faces Patty on the mat. They circle each other.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: Come on, what’re you waiting for? Greg turns to the coach.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: She's a girl, I don’t know where to grab her. Patty sees her opening and violently pins Greg, slamming to the ground. Rowley cheers wildly for Greg, but it’s cl Patty’s got him immobilized in a horribly embarrassing an intimate position. FLASHBULBS. Greg looks around and sees Angie standing off the side and pointing a camera at him. Finally, Coach Mal blows the whistle and Greg untangles himself from Patty, takes her sweet time getting off of him.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Get off me! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 90 91 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 46.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: (to coach) Can I wrestle somebody good now? Greg crosses to Coach Malone.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: That’s it. I quit.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don’t blame you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The “Whitmore Warbler”, the school newspaper, slams down Greg’s desk. ON THE FRONT PAGE ABOVE THE FOLD IS A PHOTO GREG BEING PINNED BY PATTY.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (to himself) Oh no, oh no, oh no, oh no, oh no. Greg's head is turned away from the camera so you can’t m out who he is. The headline reads: “A GREAT DAY FOR WOMEN The subhead reads: “Unidentified Male Student Pinned by Female Wrestler”. Greg looks up. Angie stares at him impassively for a mome then moves on to distribute papers to the rest of the cla He looks around, no one seems to recognize him.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to himself) Okay, you’re okay. He breathes a sigh of relief. Just then Rowley runs up to him with a newspaper of his own.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Greg, check it out, you got your picture in the paper! (to everyone, proud and loud) Greg’s in the paper! Greg looks at Rowley incredulously as the other students overhear and begin to laugh at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg walks down the hall. IN GREG’S POV, QUICK CUTS TO VARIOUS STUDENTS as they look at the picture of Greg in t paper and howl with laughter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 47.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It becomes like a horror movie as their faces are distort by funhouse lens effects and their laughter echoes throug the hallway growing louder and louder. Greg rushes down t hall and out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg trudges into the kitchen to find Rodrick sitting at table grinning broadly. He holds up the school paper.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Hey. I hear it’s a great day for women. Greg throws his backpack on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: This is all Rowley’s fault, he’s the one who sold me out.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: What do you expect, he’s an even bigger loser than you. I’d tell you to dump him, but it’s fun watching him take you down. 93 INT. GREG’S ROOM - JUST LATER 93 Greg throws himself on his bed, annoyed. He picks up his journal and starts to sketch.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Rodrick was right. Rowley’s been my problem this whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Greg and Rowley exit with other students:

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Hey Greg, after school you want to come over and (echo effect) plaayyy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bike rack in front of school. The front wheel of each arriving student’s bike is shoved into the slots. Bike. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 96 97 98 99 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 48.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bike. Bike. Bike. Bike. Big Wheel. Except it doesn’t fit. Pull back to see Rowley trying to wrestle his Big Wh into the bike rack as other kids laugh and Greg shakes hi head in disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley approach Bryce Anderson who is surrounded a gaggle of girls, including Shelly and Marley.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (to Rowley) There’s Bryce Anderson, be cool. They walk up to the group.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (trying to be cool) Hey Bryce, nice butt. Everyone stares at Rowley aghast. END FLASHBACK. INT. GREG’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS 97 He is still writing in his journal.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I knew if I wanted to change my situation at school, I was gonna have to find myself a new best friend.

dialogues.speaker: BEST FRIEND PHOTOGRAPH 98
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley are side by side at the beach, smiling fo the camera. The half of the photograph featuring Rowley’s face begins to spin like a slot machine. Greg’s face is stationary in the first reel while the second reel spins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg heads down the hall toward the Boys Room. He falls i step with COLLIN, a classmate about his age.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIN
dialogues.text: Hey, Greg. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99 100 101 102 103 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 49.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Hey, Collin. Greg looks at Collin appraisingly.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Going to the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Looks like we got a lot in common. They exit into the Boys Room.

dialogues.speaker: BEST FRIEND PHOTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: The second reel stops spinning. Collin’s face clicks into position next to Greg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Collin take their places at the urinals. Unlike Greg, who goes with his pants up, COLLIN FULLY DROPS HIS DRAWERS TO HIS ANKLES. Greg can’t believe it.

dialogues.speaker: BEST FRIEND PHOTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: The second reel begins to spin again. Collins’s out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg hurriedly exits the Boys Room and heads down the hal

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If I was going to replace Rowley, it would be pretty dumb of me to replace him with Rowley, Jr. The problem was there weren’t a lot of good best friend options around. 99 100 101 102 103  104 105 106 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 50.

dialogues.speaker: BEST FRIEND PHOTOGRAPH 104
dialogues.text: Greg is still in the first reel, the second reel is spinn Quentin’s face clicks into place.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Too annoying. The second reel spins again. Chirag Gupta’s face clicks i place.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Too depressing. The second reel spins again. Fregley’s face clicks into place.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No explanation needed. A series of SEVERAL MORE CANDIDATES, each weirder-looking than the next, click briefly into place. The second reel moves faster and faster until the faces are a blur.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Greg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg looks up to see Rowley smile and motion him over to their two corner chairs. When Greg looks at Rowley’s innocent, smiling face he suddenly wonders if he is doing right thing.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What was I thinking? I couldn’t just dump Rowley. The kid’d be lost without me. But I could fix him and change everything about him that bugs me. Because I’m a good friend, and that’s the kind of thing good friends do. He returns Rowley’s smile.

dialogues.speaker: BEST FRIEND PHOTOGRAPH 106
dialogues.text: The second reel stops spinning; Rowley’s face clicks back into place next to Greg. PULL BACK...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 107 108 109 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 51. INT. ROWLEY’S ROOM - DAY 107 ...to reveal the photograph is hanging on the wall in Rowley’s room. Greg goes through the clothes in Rowley’s closet as Rowley looks on. Greg pulls out a shirt that ha picture of Rowley and his mom. Underneath the picture it says “Me and My Mommy.”

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: This one’s gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: That was a present from my mom.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Well then your mom is trying to get you killed. He throws the shirt on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rowley sits in a chair. Greg paces in front of him like a instructor.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Want to come over and hang out?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Good. Now this time act like you don’t care if I do or not.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: But I do care.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: But you should act like you have something better going on.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Isn't that mean?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: No, it’ll make people like you. (off Rowley’s confusion) People are weird, Rowley, what do you want me to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley sit at the table, Rowley has a notebook a pen. Greg is holding Rodrick’s yearbook. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 52.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He flips to a page and holds it up for Rowley to see. It a picture of a KID SKATEBOARDING down the front steps of school.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Cool. Greg nods, flips to another page, holds it up. It’s a picture of SOME PUNKY KIDS holding guitars.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cool. Greg flips to another page, holds up another picture. It’ KID IN A SAFARI HELMET holding a box of mounted butterfli

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dork?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Good. Greg holds up another picture - a KID WEARING A SASH that reads “Spelling Bee Champion” and being handed a trophy. Rowley smiles, this one is easy.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Cool. Greg groans.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: No, dork. Dork! He's wearing a sash for godssake. We see Rowley jot something in his notebook. We can read words “sash no good” at the bottom of a list that include “no pics mommy”, “long hair ok skateboard” and “butterfli death”. INT. GREG’S ROOM - DAY 110 Greg hands Rowley a backpack. Rowley starts to put it on.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: No, one strap. One strap is cool. He demonstrates with his own backpack.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: But there’s two straps. Why would they put two straps on if you’re only supposed to use one? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 111 112 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 53.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Just trust me, Rowley, have I ever steered you wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, a lot.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: One strap, Rowley! EXT. ROWLEY’S GARAGE - DAY 111 Greg wheels Rowley’s bike out of the garage. It is dusty has seen very little service.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: The Big Wheel has to go. You’re in middle school now. Man up.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: But I don’t really know how --

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Every kid in the history of forever could ride a bike. You'll be fine. Rowley mounts the bike and starts to roll down the drivew He quickly loses control and crashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg waits by the bike rack in front of school watching a Rowley rides up. IN SLO-MO: We get a good look at the “improved” Rowley. H looks terrified and is tilting to one side from the weigh his giant backpack which is slung over one shoulder. He rolls slowly, wobbling precariously. He is barely able to stop in time to avoid crashing into the bike rack.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (slo-mo effect) Aaah. END SLO-MO. As Rowley stands by the bike rack, gasping for air.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don’t want to get ahead of myself, but I will say I did an amazing job of improving Rowley. He was ready to be the friend of a Class Favorite.  113 114 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class is in their seats as Ms. Darnell makes some mor announcements.

dialogues.speaker: MS. DARNELL
dialogues.text: ..-And finally, there are some spots available on Safety Patrol. If anyone’s interested, see me after homeroom. This gets Greg’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF QUICK CUTS of Greg as he suits up for Safety Patrol. Orange vest strapped on. Sides of vest cinched. Badge clipped on. Sneaker laces tightened. Sunscreen slapped on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and his fellow Safety Patrols strut down the hallway SLO MO through a haze of smoke a la The Right Stuff. Greg passes SHELLY AND MARLEY who watch him and giggle.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: Greg Heffley has a cute butt.

dialogues.speaker: AN OPEN YEARBOOK
dialogues.text: A full page photo of Greg with his back to us, looking ov his shoulder at the camera. The caption reads “Best Butt”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class is gone. Greg and Rowley are at Ms. Darnell’s desk. She hands them badges and orange vests.

dialogues.speaker: MS. DARNELL
dialogues.text: Okay, you'll be walking the kindergartners home after their half day. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 117 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 55.

dialogues.speaker: MS. DARNELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They go right after lunch, so you'll be excused from the first twenty minutes of sixth period.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: But that means we'll miss half of alge- Greg gives Rowley a big pinch.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- brahooey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg saunters toward the front door of the school with Rowley. They are in their orange plastic Safety Patrol ve and each has a cup of steaming cocoa.
