dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So we enlisted. And get this, because Safety Patrols are outside a lot, we get special, exclusive Safety Patrol cocoa. Greg takes a sip of his cocoa, Collin passes by. Angie is further down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIN
dialogues.text: Wow. Is that cocoa?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (officious) Sorry. Safety Patrols only. Greg continues on, Rowley shoots Collin a rueful look.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Sorry. Angie is annoyed by Greg’s attitude toward Collin.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: You might want to ease up a little, Heffley.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: I mean, it’s just Safety Patrol. In middle school. It’s the lowest of the low. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 56.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I don’t think you understand the seriousness of our job. Greg throws open the front door to reveal Ms. Darnell wai outside with EIGHT LITTLE KINDERGARTEN KIDS.

dialogues.speaker: MS. DARNELL
dialogues.text: Okay, these are the kids you’1ll be walking home.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: Actually, it’s the lowest of the lowest of the low. Greg glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “December. Wednesday.” Greg and Rowley are at the foot of the elementary school steps with the kindergartners lined up in a row on the sidewalk. Rowley suddenly sees THE PICKUP TRUCK FROM HALLOWEEN almost upon them.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Greg, it’s those guys from Halloween. Greg looks where Rowley is pointing and sees the pickup. EXTREME CLOSE-UPS: Shredded paint on the side of the truc Pete behind the wheel; Wade in the pickup bed with the fi extinguisher. As the truck passes them, PETE SEES GREG. GREG SEES PETE HIM. The truck stops and quickly reverses back to where G and Rowley were standing. BUT NOW IT’S JUST THE KINDERGARTNERS -- NO GREG AND ROWLEY. Pete puts the truck in park and is about to investigate w a CAR HONKS BEHIND them. Wade starts pounding on the back window.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: (re: car behind them) Dude, it’s Principal Kinney, go go go! As Pete throws it in drive and speeds away, THE CAMERA MO

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY FLAT ON THE GROUND BEHIND THEM.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120 121 122 123 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 57.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: That was close.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: So close. Rowley looks at Greg a beat then smiles. Greg starts to chuckle. As they laugh together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the cheese as snow falls on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids pour out of the school, happy to escape captivity. G stands by the curb, in his Safety Patrol badge and vest. sees some kids step into the street.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Wait for the light, people. Feeling pretty good about himself, Greg turns back toward school AS THE KIDS SHRUG AND CROSS ANYWAY.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There’s just something about a man in uniform. Even a plastic one. Now that I was on Safety Patrol everything was falling into place, I was on the road to Class Favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is decorated for Christmas with twinkly lights a wreath on the door.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So I went into Christmas vacation feeling pretty good and ready to enjoy our Heffley family holiday traditions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, Frank and Rodrick sit on the couch eating pie and watching a BIKINI BEACH MOVIE ON TV. A decorated tree glo behind them. It’s nice, peaceful even. Rodrick notices Manny on the floor going through his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Manny, get out of my stuff! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123 124 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 58.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Manny slowly turns his head and glares at Rodrick for a b He then walks over and squeezes in on the end of the couc next to them. ANGLE ON the TV, on which two young women in bikinis are bouncily running in slo-motion on the beach. PAN DOWN THE ROW OF HEFFLEY MEN -- First Frank, then Rodr then Greg all with the same enthralled expression. Finall we land on Manny, WHO STARTS TO YELL.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: Aaaaah! Aaaaah! Aaaaah! Susan runs in.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What? What’s going on? Then she sees the TV.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you watching? Turn that off.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I don’t want Manny exposed to that kind of thing. Women are more than just a place to hang a bikini.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: But these women are smart. Tracey and Sabrina are about to solve a dognapping. Susan looks at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I told them to turn it off. Manny grabs the remote and changes the channel to a CARTO He then turns to Rodrick and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley are walking up the hill. Rowley has his B Wheel, Greg has the football. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 124 125 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I’m thinking when we get back to school, it’s time for me to really make my move. Maybe run for student council. Something easy, like Treasurer.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Isn't that a lot of math?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: You could do the math. You could be the man behind the man.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: I got a C in math.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Hm. Greg stops, Rowley continues to the top of the hill.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I didn’t know exactly what it was going to be, I just knew I needed my big break. Rowley turns his Big Wheel downhill.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ready? 59. 124 Rowley takes off down the hill. As Rowley speeds past on Big Wheel, Greg fires a tight spiral directly at him. ball hits Rowley’s front wheel.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yes! The

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY AND THE BIG WHEEL ARE KNOCKED OFF COURSE, HIT A CU
dialogues.text: AND GO AIRBORNE. Rowley flies through the air, then crash into a snow drift.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Only the way it turned out, the big break wasn’t mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “January. Monday.” Students trudge into the school. 125  126 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rowley’s left hand is in a cast. He stands at his locker. Reveal Greg a few feet away looking at him sheepishly. He takes a deep breath, crosses to Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (keeping it light) Hey, that was some ride, Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Hmm. Shelly and Marley pass by. Shelly notices Rowley’s cast a stops.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Broke it.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Big Wheel accident. Shelly and Marley laugh.

dialogues.speaker: MARLEY
dialogues.text: You’re funny.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: Does it still hurt?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: MARLEY
dialogues.text: You poor thing.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: Can I sign your cast?

dialogues.speaker: MARLEY
dialogues.text: Me, too! Other girls gather around Rowley and push Greg further an further back until he is shoved right out of the crowd. G does not like being stuck on the outside and pushes his w back into the circle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 126 127 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 61.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! I’m the one who broke his hand. The girls all turn to look at Greg.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: Then you're a jerk. The girls turn back to Rowley as Greg slinks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, with his lunch tray, heads toward his usual seat at edge of the room when he sees something shocking. Rowley a table with Shelly, Marley and some other popular girls. There are no empty seats. As Greg watches, Shelly feeds Rowley a bite of food. Rowley says something Greg can’t h and the girls laugh. This pushes Greg to his limit.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I couldn't believe it. Rowley was eating at an actual table -- and all because of a stupid broken hand. And he doesn’t even care where he eats. If anyone should be at a table, it’s me. He looks out across the room, at the tables full of unwelcoming kids. His eyes fall on Angie who is sitting a table nearby. There is an empty seat next to her.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: I'd ask you to join me, but this table’s for people on the paper, not in the paper. Greg sighs and heads in the other direction, back to his usual place. He stops when sees Fregley is sitting in Rowley’s old seat. But Greg really has no place else to g He glumly sits.

dialogues.speaker: FREGLEY
dialogues.text: Hey Greg Heffley, want to see me eat my whole sandwich in one bite?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: No thanks. But Fregley does it anyway, stuffing his entire sandwich his mouth. He grins and points to his mouth, “See, did it Greg's eyes drift back to Rowley’s table.  128 129 130 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 62. INT. GREG’S BEDROOM - LATER 128 Greg is on his bed, sketching in his journal. We see a cartoon of Rowley at the lunch table with the girls.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I realized Rowley’s injury thing was a pretty good racket, so I decided it was time for me to have an injury of my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg throws his backpack in his locker. We see that one a is now wrapped in gauze. He grabs a notebook from his loc and crosses to Shelly and Marley. He thrusts his arm towa the girls.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Hey guys, check it out.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It’s a raging infection caused by a splinter that was left untreated. The girls just look at him. He holds up his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Want to be the first to sign my sympathy sheet? The girls wrinkle their noses in disgust and walk away. Fregley approaches.

dialogues.speaker: FREGLEY
dialogues.text: Can I peek at your infection?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are hanging around before homeroom starts. Greg enters, unwrapping the gauze from his hand. As he stuffs in the trash he notices Rowley and Collin talking.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: ...and on the x-ray you could see where the bone just snapped right in half. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 63.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIN
dialogues.text: Wow. I broke a toe once. It got all purple.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Hey Gregory, want to sign the card?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: You got Rowley a card?!

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: What? No. It’s for Bryan Little, you know the guy who does that Wacky Dawg cartoon for the school paper? He has mono and he’s going to be out for three months. Greg notices that a bunch of kids are gathered around the teacher’s desk signing a big posterboard card. The card h a drawing of a dog with a sad face and says “We’re going miss you, Wacky Dawg.”

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (suddenly interested) Bryan Little’s sick? So who’s going to do the cartoon?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: They're having tryouts. But the important thing is that Bryan get better.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (distracted) Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This was what I'd been waiting for all year. Everyone loves the cartoon guy. I mean, Bryan Little was Class Clown last year because of Wacky Dawg. And I draw cartoons all the time, it’s like my biggest talent. I knew I could take something like this right to the top.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 131 132 133 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie Rose is interviewing Greg, who looks natty in a t blazer with leather elbow patches.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE ROSE
dialogues.text: Let’s talk about how funny you are. What is that Greg Heffley “thing” that we all want but only you have?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It’s three things, Charlie. Charisma. Good looks. Humility.

dialogues.speaker: AN OPEN YEARBOOK
dialogues.text: A full page photo of Greg holding up several school paper cartoons. The caption reads “Class Clown”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley sit at the kitchen table drawing cartoons

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I decided to go ahead and forgive Rowley for milking the broken hand so hard, and told him he could work on the cartoon with me. Chuckling, Rowley hands Greg a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Here, what about this? Greg looks at it, it’s a series of three cartoons. Each o ends with the punchline “Zoo Wee Mama!”

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (excited) Zoo Wee Mama!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It’s the same joke every time.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Zoo Wee Mama! Rowley cracks up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 65.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: We can’t just do the same thing over and over.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: We can if it’s Zoo Wee Mama. Greg tosses Rowley’s papers aside.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It needs to be a little more sophisticated. Like mine is about a really dumb guy and he does dumb stuff that’s funny. Greg picks up a pencil...

dialogues.speaker: THE CARTOON BEGINS TO DRAW ITSELF AS GREG DOES THE VOICES
dialogues.text: FIRST FRAME: CREIGHTON holds something shaped like a box his hand.

dialogues.speaker: CREIGHTON
dialogues.text: I wonder what is in this cute little box. SECOND FRAME: Creighton has been joined by a kid ina baseball cap (CREIGHTON’S FRIEND). The kid points at Creighton... CREIGHTON’S FRIEND That’s not a box, it’s a brick, you dumb moron!

dialogues.speaker: CREIGHTON
dialogues.text: Oops. I have been trying to open it all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drawing in front of Greg is now finished. Greg looks Rowley, expecting him to laugh at the cartoon.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (unsmiling) Can he say Zoo Wee Mama? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 135 136 137 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 66.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Rowley, forget Zoo Wee Mama. This is serious business. Do you want me to be Class Clown or don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: But I like Zoo Wee Mama.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: You know what, if you like it so much then you should just go do it yourself. The idea of doing it alone has never occurred to Rowley. thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Okay. See ya. Rowley grabs his cartoons and goes. Greg is clearly surprised by this flash of independence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “February. Wednesday.” It is a bleak, gray rainy day.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Safety Patrol was getting to be a drag because of the weather. But I figured once I got the cartoon, I’d just dump it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg crosses to Rowley who is at his locker.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I forgot my raincoat so I’m gonna need you to walk the kids home today.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: I can’t. I can’t get my cast wet. Rowley holds up his broken hand. Greg sighs.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: You can borrow my coat. He holds up a bright red slicker.  138 139 140 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, wearing Rowley’s coat with the hood up, is hunched against the rain as he herds the kindergartners along the sidewalk. Suddenly, he sees the TEEN’S TRUCK making a tur toward them at the end of the street. He stops cold.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Oh no. Greg frantically looks around for an escape route, but there’s nothing but houses. One of the houses is being renovated; the construction site is deserted. Then he spi it: A CONSTRUCTION DUMPSTER. It’s his only hope. He looks at the truck, which is getting closer. He spins around at the kids.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Okay, listen up! We’re being attacked by space monsters and they’re going to eat us unless we can get into that dumpster! Now follow me if you want to live!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg is hoisting terrified kids into the dumpster. Greg looks up to see THE TRUCK STOP AT A STOP SIGN JUST A HALF BLOCK AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Come on! Move it! lLet’s go! Greg helps what he thinks is the last kid in the dumpster but looks over and sees a one small straggler in a puffy parka wandering off. Greg takes off for the kid. SLO-MO: Greg races across the site to the kid, hoists him over his shoulders like a soldier carrying a fallen comra stagger-runs back to the dumpster, and THROWS THE KID IN.

dialogues.speaker: DUMPSTER. END SLO-MO.
dialogues.text: Greg doesn’t have time to take a breath because THE TRUCK BEARING DOWN ON THEM. He turns around to get into the dumpster himself and is confronted by YET ANOTHER KID HE FORGOT, a big husky one this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg strains to push the hefty kid into the dumpster. He’ almost got him in, but...it’s too late. The truck is on them...but IT’S NOT THE TEEN’S TRUCK AT ALL. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 140 141 142 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 68.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Same color, make, and model, but a lone woman is inside i driving. Phew. He relaxes his grip on the kid who teeters on the edge of the dumpster...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. IRVINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey you! Greg looks over, LETTING GO OF THE KID, WHO FALLS IN. It’ MRS. IRVINE, an older woman standing on her porch in a housecoat, and she doesn’t look happy. Her hair is in curlers under a clear plastic rain bonnet.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. IRVINE
dialogues.text: (mad) Rowley Jefferson, is that you?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (hiding his face) Yes, Mrs. Irvine. Mrs. Irvine walks toward him. Panicked, Greg turns tail a runs off before she can see his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Irvine looks inside the dumpster. A dog pile of kids crowded into the dirty dumpster look back up at her. With her curlers under the rain bonnet and her makeup running the rain, she looks a little scary. One BOY KINDERGARTNER clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: BOY KINDERGARTNER
dialogues.text: Are you going to eat us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are watching the principal, MR. WINSKY, making announcements on the closed circuit TV on the wall. He re from papers in front of him like a newscaster.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WINSKY
dialogues.text: ++.SO to whoever took the lizard out of the science lab and put it in my car, you should know that it was very cold yesterday and the lizard is now in intensive care. Mr. Winsky sets aside that paper and reads another announcement. MR. WINSKY (CONT’D) On a happier note, they’ve selected the new cartoon for the school paper. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 142 143 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 69.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A murmur of excitement goes through the class. Greg smile expectantly. MR. WINSKY (CONT’D) The winner is... Greg leans forward in his chair, preparing to stand up an accept congratulations. MR. WINSKY (CONT’D) ..."Zoo Wee Mama” by Rowley Jefferson! Greg is shocked. Everyone claps for Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I couldn't believe it. But I guess it says a lot about the intelligence level at my school, and it doesn’t make me feel real hopeful about the future of our country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg grimly stands next to Rowley who is being chatted up Shelly and Marley. Rowley is basking in the attention.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: Will you put me in your cartoon?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Sure. Heh-heh.

dialogues.speaker: MARLEY
dialogues.text: And me too -- ooh, I want to be the one who says Zoo Wee Mama.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Okay. Angie approaches.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: Hey, Rowley, congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: You deserve it. I read all the submissions and yours was definitely the best. (to Greg) I read yours, too. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 143 144 145 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 70.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Angie crosses away as Bryce passes.

dialogues.speaker: BRYCE
dialogues.text: Hey, Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Hey. (happily, to Greg) Wow, everyone knows me now. It’s like I’m famous. Greg is dead inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Worth addresses the class.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WORTH
dialogues.text: .-+-So why did America send soldiers to England?

dialogues.speaker: BRYCE
dialogues.text: Because America rocks!

dialogues.speaker: MR. WORTH
dialogues.text: Well...yes. But in this case it was because Germany had... (writes on board) ...invaded -- Mr. Worth drops his chalk.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WORTH
dialogues.text: Zoo Wee Mama! The whole class cracks up (except for Greg) and Bryce hig fives Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, the failure of the public school system was complete. The way I see it, Rowley and the rest of these bozos deserve each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley are walking down the hall. They pass a do that “MR. WINSKY, PRINCIPAL”. Mr. Winsky sticks his head out; he does not look happy.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WINSKY
dialogues.text: Rowley Jefferson? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 145 146 147 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 71.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Yes, Principal Winsky?

dialogues.speaker: MR. WINSKY
dialogues.text: I need to see you in my office. Rowley shoots Greg a worried look and crosses to Mr. Wins They go in the office and Mr. Winsky shuts the door. Greg looks around to make sure nobody's watching, then crosses the door, peeks in the glass window pane. INT. MR. WINSKY’S OFFICE —- CONTINUOUS 146 Mr. Winsky sits at his desk. Rowley sits in the chair acr from him. He looks very small. We see Greg hovering just outside the door, but Mr. Winsky doesn’t notice him.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WINSKY
dialogues.text: I got a call from Mrs. Irvine about what happened with the kindergartners last week. She’s very upset. Rowley looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back with Greg outside the door. He looks alarmed. He pee in the window again. From his perspective we see Mr. Wins really laying into Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WINSKY
dialogues.text: .+-you brought dishonor to our school and you disrespected the badge.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: I really don’t --

dialogues.speaker: MR. WINSKY
dialogues.text: Save it. You're going to apologize to those kids tomorrow and you're suspended from Safety Patrol for a week. Including cocoa. Now get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Rowley exits Mr. Winsky’s office, joining Greg in the hal

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (devastated) I’m suspended for a week. I don’t even know what’s he’s talking about. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 72.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rowley trudges to his locker, Greg watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Rowley, I...

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg comes home. Susan is there, cooking dinner. She take one look at him and knows something is up.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Greg hesitates a beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I’m in kind of a tough situation.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Sit. Tell me. Greg and Susan sit at the table.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I know something and if I tell the truth about it, it could hurt somebody.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Namely me, but I kept that part to myself.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Well, I think you can never go wrong being honest. On Greg thinking:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family is celebrating GRAMPA HEFFLEY’S birthday. Susa sets a cake down in front of Grampa. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 149 150 151 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 73.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Make a wish, Grampa!

dialogues.speaker: GRAMPA
dialogues.text: I wish for chocolate cake next year.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: If you're alive next year. Everyone glares at Greg.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m just trying to be realistic. END FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan and Greg continue their talk.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You just have to go with your gut and try to do the right thing, because it’s our choices that make us who we are. Greg nods. Susan kisses Greg and exits. Greg chews over what she has just said. EXT. ELEMENTARY SCHOOL —- MORNING 151 Greg is walking to school. He has dark circles under his eyes and looks glum.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was up all night tossing and turning about this Rowley situation, but I finally figured out what the right thing to do was. He stops. Reveal Greg is standing across the street from Elementary School. On the steps of the school are Rowley, Mr. Winsky and the kindergarten students.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (to kids) I’m sorry I terrorized you children. The children look at each other, confused.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I decided to let Rowley take one for the team this time. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 151 152 153 154 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 74.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now that he had the cartoon he didn’t even need Safety Patrol anymore. Really, I was probably doing him a favor. Head bowed, Rowley sadly hands Mr. Winsky his badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg comes in the back door from school wearing his backp Susan turns around from baking something.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: How'd it go? Did you do the right thing?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I think so. Susan smiles, proud of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg is in a booth with Susan. A GIANT HOT FUDGE SUNDAE i placed in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Dig in. You earned it. Greg takes a bite. It’s sawdust in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rowley is sitting on the front steps. Greg approaches; he notices Rowley steal a sad glance at his safety patrol ge

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (glum) Did the kids ask about me?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Uh...no.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Oh. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: So, it’s kind of funny. You know that whole Safety Patrol thing? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 75.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Well, you remember that day you lent me your jacket? See, I thought I saw those guys from Halloween and so, you know, otherwise I never would've, but... Okay. I’m the one who threw those kids in the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah, and I think we can both learn some valuable lessons from this. Like, I should be more careful what I do in front of Mrs. Irvine’s house. And you...well, you should be more careful who you lend your coat to. Rowley looks at him steadily for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: You know what, you’re not a good friend.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Whoa, how can you even say that? I’m a great friend.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: If you were a great friend you would've told Mr. Winsky the truth.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Okay, one thing, you can’t get mad about just --

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: You're always bossing me around. You weren’t happy I got the cartoon. You broke my hand and you didn’t even seem sorry!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: That broken hand was the best thing that ever happened to you.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Don’t call me, don’t come by my house. We're done. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 154 155 156 157 158 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 76.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rowley exits, leaving Greg alone in the empty school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids are hanging out in the snowy front yard before the f bell. Greg watches Rowley who is deep in conversation wit Angie.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I thought the whole thing would blow over, but Rowley was still giving me the silent treatment, even when I tried to make the first move. GREG THROWS A SNOWBALL AT ROWLEY, it hits him on the back the head. Rowley turns around and Greg smiles and gives h a friendly wave. Rowley and Angie just glare at him and continue their conversation. INT. MR. WINSKY’S OFFICE - DAY 156 Greg and Rowley face Mr. Winsky who is holding Greg’s bad

dialogues.speaker: MR. WINSKY
dialogues.text: Thanks to an anonymous tipster, I now know the whole story. Greg, you’re relieved of your Safety Patrol duties, effective immediately. (turns to Rowley) Rowley, for showing dignity under false suspicion, I’m promoting you to Team Captain. As Mr. Winsky hands Rowley a new, bigger badge, Greg look out the glass window of Mr. Winsky’s door. He sees Angie just outside the door watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley exit Mr. Winsky’s office.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Hey, Cap’n, you’re still gonna hook me up with cocoa, right? Rowley ignores him and walks off with Angie. Greg watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are in the frozen food aisle. Greg trails Susan who pushing Manny in the cart. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 158 159 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 77.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Should I get some more pizzas? Is Rowley coming over this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. We’re kind of on the outs.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Why? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Nothing. He got mad because I -- never mind.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Okay. She keeps moving down the aisle. At the end of the aisle a rack full of Valentine’s Day cards.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (taking a card) Maybe it would help if you made a gesture. Like, say, send hima card for Valentine’s day. They have friend ones. Greg is stunned by the awfulness of this idea.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Mom, you've had a lot of bad ideas. Band camp. Getting me and Rodrick matching jackets. The family canoe trip. But that, that’s the worst. Susan watches him walk away and doesn’t notice that Manny taken the card and started chewing on it. When she looks back, it’s all gummed up and slimy. Susan hurriedly puts back in the rack behind some other cards and moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “March. Thursday.” Much like the first day of school, Greg walks down the ha alone, surrounded by kids who pay no attention to him. He watches as Collin crosses to Rowley, carrying an overnigh bag.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIN
dialogues.text: Hey Rowley, my mom says it’s okay for me to sleep over tonight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 159 160 161 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 78.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Awesome! Greg watches Rowley and Collin head off together.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The whole thing with Rowley is, I was willing to let bygones be bygones but then he made friends with Collin just to mess with me. As if I even care if he -- CRACK. INT. GREG’S ROOM - NIGHT 160 Greg is on his bed writing in his journal. He looks at hi pencil and realizes he’s broken the tip off from the fierceness of his writing. He flops back on his bed and stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well you know what? Two can play at that game. EXT. ROWLEY’S STREET - DUSK 161 Rowley and Collin are playing in Rowley’s front yard. Gre carrying an overnight bag, walks super-casually past them the next house, where Fregley is playing alone in the fro yard. Rowley and Collin watch Greg pass, but nobody says word. Greg walks up to Fregley, who is stabbing a kite with a stick.

dialogues.speaker: FREGLEY
dialogues.text: Hey Greg Heffley.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What’s happening, Fregley?

dialogues.speaker: FREGLEY
dialogues.text: Killing a kite. Greg shoots a look toward Rowley and Collin. Rowley is watching Greg, but when he sees Greg look at him, he quic looks away.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I was thinking maybe you might want to have a sleepover. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 161 162 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 79.

dialogues.speaker: FREGLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. With who?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: FREGLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah! When?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (losing patience) Now.

dialogues.speaker: FREGLEY
dialogues.text: (jumping up and down) Alright! We're gonna be best friends forever!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. (loudly, for Rowley’s benefit) I can’t believe I was able to pencil you in for a sleepover, what with my busy schedule.

dialogues.speaker: FREGLEY
dialogues.text: Greg Heffley, I love you!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (glancing at Rowley) Uh-huh, uh-huh, let’s just get inside. Greg shepherds Fregley toward his front door. INT. FREGLEY’S BEDROOM - LATER 162 Greg is at the window looking out. Fregley has set up a twister mat.

dialogues.speaker: FREGLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, Greg Heffley, you wanna play twister? Do ya? Wanna? Twister? Greg looks at Fregley for a beat, then turns back to the window. FROM GREG'S POV we see that Rowley and Collin are still in Rowley’s yard.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: You know what, Fregley, maybe this wasn’t such a good -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 162 163 164 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 80.

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: Greg turns and sees Fregley has gone through his overnigh bag and pulled out a A BAG OF JELLYBEANS which he is feverishly stuffing into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: FREGLEY
dialogues.text: I’m not supposed to have sugar. Not even a little. My mom says it makes me cr-aaa-zzz-yyyy! (maniacal laugh) Hahahahahahaha! Fregley empties the rest of the bag into his mouth. INT. FREGLEY’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER 163 Greg is backed as far into the corner as he can go. Alarm he watches Fregley twitch and dance. Fregley leaps up ont his bed.

dialogues.speaker: I. FEEL. LIKE. SUUUPERMAAAAAN
dialogues.text: He fixes his eyes on Greg. FREGLEY (CONT’D) I will destroy you, Lex Luthor! Suddenly, he makes a flying leap at Greg who dodges out o the way.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (calls for help) Hey, Mrs....uh, Fregley?! Hello??? Is anybody there?? Fregley jumps to his feet and faces Greg.

dialogues.speaker: HA HA HA HA
dialogues.text: Fregley charges Greg. Greg makes for the door. He throws the door open and runs out with Fregley in hot pursuit. INT. FREGLEY’S HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS 164 Greg races down the hall. He doesn’t know where he’s heading. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 164 165 166 167 168 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 81.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Fregley is right behind him, chasing him with his index finger outstretched. Greg spots an open door at the end o the hall. The bathroom. He races inside and slams the doo behind him, locking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg catches his breath. We hear LOUD THUMPING SOUNDS as Fregley throws his body against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, traumatized, sits in a little ball on the floor. It quiet. No sound from Fregley. Then a PIECE OF PAPER slide under the door. Greg gingerly crosses to it, picks it up reads it. The letter reads: “DEAR GREG HEFFLEY, I’M VERY SORRY I CH

dialogues.speaker: YOU WITH A BOOGER ON MY FINGER. HERE, I PUT IT ON THIS PA
dialogues.text: SO YOU CAN GET ME BACK.” At the bottom of the page is an arrow that points directl where Greg’s thumb is. Greg moves his thumb. JUST UNDERNEATH WHERE HIS THUMB HAD BEEN IS A BOOGER. Greg sta to sway gently as his head swims with the horror. As he starts to topple over... THE SCREEN GOES BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cheese is alone on the deserted sport court, surround by grimy old snow.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You know, to be honest I’m a lot better off without friends. All friends do is drag you down and suck the life out of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg parks his bike in the bike rack, next to Rowley’s Bi Wheel.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Rowley’s been nothing but a distraction. Now that I’m on my own and don't have to worry about carrying around all that dead weight, I can get back to the business of making a name for myself.  169 170 171 172 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg stands in front of a poster that reads “SPRING PLAY AUDITIONS TODAY”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg is on stage in Shakespearean garb and with long, art hair, taking his bows in front of an audience of kids. Th are really going crazy for him. Rowley is in the audience too. He is so amazed by Greg’s performance, he can’t help but stand up and join the adulation.

dialogues.speaker: AN OPEN YEARBOOK
dialogues.text: A full page photo of Greg in his drama get-up. Underneath the caption “Most Talented”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of kids are gathered in the audience seats. A gro of six kids, including Greg and Patty Farrell, are groupe around the piano on the stage. The drama teacher, MRS. NORTON, sits at the piano. Coach Malone, clearly assigned against his will, is there to assist.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NORTON
dialogues.text: Greg Heffley, step forward. Mrs. Norton plays the opening bars of “My Country ‘Tis Of Thee.” GREG BEGINS TO SING IN A SURPRISINGLY CLEAR AND PU SOPRANO.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (singing) My country ‘tis of thee/sweet land of liberty/of thee I sing... Mrs. Norton is so surprised she stops playing.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NORTON
dialogues.text: That was...that was very good, Greg. One moment please. She huddles with Coach Malone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 83.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MRS. NORTON (CONT’D) He has amazing tone. I wonder if he...could play Dorothy?

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Well, if girls can wrestle I guess anything goes around here. Greg overhears this. So do some of the other kids, and th start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYBILL-TYPE LEAFLET
dialogues.text: The “Wizard of Oz” Playbill featuring Greg on the cover dressed as Dorothy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg looks mortified.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: No, no I don’t want to be Dorothy.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: (shrieks ) He can’t be Dorothy! I’m Dorothy!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NORTON
dialogues.text: Alright, Patty, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: (in meltdown mode) I’m Dorothy! I am! My mom is president of the PTA, she can ruin your life! Everyone stares at Patty aghast.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NORTON
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Greg, you’ve been cast as a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Heffley family eats dinner. Manny is sitting on his potty. Greg slides into his seat.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: Bubby! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 175 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 84.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Mom, make him stop calling me that.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Auditioning for the school play.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: (excited) The play? Really?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Was it some kind of punishment? Frank chuckles. No one else does. Greg sits, starts helpi himself to food.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It's The Wizard of Oz and I’m going to be a tree.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Oh, I remember the trees. In the movie they throw apples at Dorothy.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Really? That could be cool.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Could be. But it won’t be. ‘Cause it’s lame.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: It is not. I’m so proud of you, Greg.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: No, really. This is a very proud moment and I just want to acknowledge that. We’re all so busy, we never take the time to tell each other stuff like that. I love you guys. Susan squeezes Rodrick’s hand. RODRICK BURPS LOUDLY. Fran and Greg start to laugh, then stop when they see the look Susan’s face.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine, I’m sorry I shared a feeling. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 175 176 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She gets up and angrily begins clearing dishes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Honey. Come on. (then) Rodrick.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Sorry, mom.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I’m fine. She’s not. She’s pissed. She exits. Frank looks at Rodrick.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m going to pay for that. He exits after Susan.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: (to Greg) Way to wreck dinner, jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg is being fitted for his tree outfit. Patty Farrell nearby practising some dance moves. As Mrs. Norton fits tube over Greg, he notices there are no arm holes.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Wait, we don’t get armholes? How are we going to throw apples at Dorothy without armholes?

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: Hold on, nobody's throwing anything at me. I was Annie in the Strasberg Camp for the Performing Arts production of “Annie.”

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NORTON
dialogues.text: Nobody's throwing anything at anybody.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NORTON
dialogues.text: (to Greg) I changed the play a little bit and you won’t need armholes. 85. 175 176 is the (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 176 177 178 179 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 86.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and his fellow trees, ARCHIE KELLY and MARTY PORTER lined up on stage in their tree costumes, miserably singi Mrs. Norton places other kids, dressed as shrubs, around stage. She places RODNEY JAMES (Bush #2) right next to th trees.

dialogues.speaker: TREES
dialogues.text: We three trees from yonder glen/Do spy a maiden fair and sweet... Greg looks down and notices Rodney is playing a video gam hidden inside his bush costume. WE HEAR VIDEO GAME BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: TREES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...-Whilst we are rooted to our spots/She doth move on lighter feet./With her dog so small and true/We hope she fares well, indeed we do. The trees finish their song and start to wobble offstage, ARCHIE KELLY DOESN’T SEE RODNEY AND TAKES A HEADER RIGHT HIM. Because he has no arm holes, Archie can’t break his fall.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Aah, my tooth, I think I knocked out my tooth! Mrs. Norton rushes over and pulls Archie to his feet. As struggles to get him up...

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (to Mrs. Norton) Guess we need arm holes after all. Mrs. Norton glares at Greg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “Show night.” Parents and kids stream in and take their seats. Murmurin anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty as Dorothy and Chirag as her dog Toto are mid-scene (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 87.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: (as Dorothy) Come on, Toto, let’s explore this magical path! Chirag doesn’t move fast enough for Patty’s taste.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (snaps) I said come on! They move toward the other side of the stage and reach Th Trees. A SPOTLIGHT FINDS GREG AND THE REST OF THE TREES. Greg looks out into the audience and sees his whole famil Mom, Dad, Manny and Rodrick, who is filming him with a camcorder. Susan holds a bouquet of flowers.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: Bubby! Manny’s word rings out in the auditorium. Greg looks out the crowd. Some of the kids in the audience laugh. CLOSE GREG as his eyes dart back and forth looking for a way ou this.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (to Archie, loudly) Hey Bubby, I think you dropped an apple.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Huh? A LARGER LAUGH from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: (as Dorothy) What say you, Toto? Should we explore this intriguing yellow path?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (as Toto) Bow wow. Patty and Chirag exit to the wings. Mrs. Norton, sitting the side of the stage, plays the opening bars of “We Thre Trees.” The trees start to sing.

dialogues.speaker: TREES
dialogues.text: We three trees from yonder glen/Do spy a maiden fair and sweet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 179 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 88.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Greg looks out into the audience and sees ROWLEY AND COLL Collin whispers something in Rowley’s ear and Rowley look Greg and giggles. GREG STOPS SINGING.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY /ARCHIE
dialogues.text: Whilst we are rooted to... Marty and Archie look at Greg questioningly. He just star back at them, eyes wide. His fear is contagious and their singing trails off... Mrs. Norton stops playing and stands up to see what’s goi on. Now there is silence. A long silence. Patty stands off-stage watching and getting angrier.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NORTON
dialogues.text: (desperate loud whisper) Whilst we are rooted to our spots, she doth move on lighter feet. The other trees look at Greg, but he just stares off into space. Patty is now hopping mad.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: (angry whisper) Sing. Sing. (then loudly) Sing! A kid in the crowd (AUDIENCE KID) yells out amid the deafening silence.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE KID
dialogues.text: This bites! It’s too much for Patty. She steps out onto the stage.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: (screams ) You're not good at anything Greg Heffley! Greg looks at Patty with hate in his eyes. He looks down the apple on the stage floor, and then at his new armhole Screw it.

dialogues.speaker: HE GRABS THE APPLE OFF THE FLOOR AND CHUNKS IT AS HARD AS
dialogues.text: CAN AT PATTY. Patty’s hand snaps up and snatches the appl out of the air, like Superman catching a bullet. She glar at Greg then HURLS THE APPLE BACK AT HIM, hitting him in trunk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 179 180 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 89.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The other trees and Greg start pulling apples off their branches and pelting Patty as fast as they can. She retur fire just as rapidly. THE STAGE IS A HAIL OF APPLES. The audience is stunned into silence. Except for ANGIE. She i standing in the aisle and had been taking pictures, but i mesmerized by the action onstage she’s now simply watchin

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: Yeah! Susan is mortified. Rodrick is filming madly, trying to catch all the action. A nearby dad, who thinks he’s funny (FUNNY DAD) leans over to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FUNNY DAD
dialogues.text: (points to Greg) What’s the worst thing that kid could say to you? Frank shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: FUNNY DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Hi, dad.” Funny Dad laughs at his own joke.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah, heh heh, good one. Mrs. Norton has climbed the stage and is hurriedly CLOSIN THE CURTAIN. The last thing we see before the curtain shu is PATTY RUSHES GREG AND TACKLES HIM LIKE A LINEBACKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience is streaming out of the auditorium. Several families wait outside, congratulating/consoling their lit “stars.” The Heffleys are there, as is the FUNNY DAD from before. Greg walks up to them.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Hey, dad. Frank looks over at Funny Dad, sees him looking at them. Funny Dad quickly averts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: (holds up camera) I own you now. Susan throws her bouquet of flowers in the trash and stea out the door with Manny. Greg looks to his dad. Frank loo at Funny Dad, then puts his arm around Greg. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 180 181 182 183 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 90.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I thought Dorothy deserved it. Greg looks at him gratefully. They head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “April. Monday.” The school yard is full of happy kids playing. Greg walks to THE CHEESE.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: These days, I don’t feel much like doing anything. I don’t know why. Maybe I have lyme disease. Various kids run by, including Rowley and Collin, now wea MATCHING “BEST FRIENDS” T-SHIRTS. Greg sighs, looks sadly down at the cheese. He is completely alone.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND GREG, WHO REMAINS MOTIONLESS. THE SUN COMES OUT,
dialogues.text: FLOWERS BLOOM. IT’S DEEP INTO SPRING WHEN TIME SLOWS DOWN AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “May. Thursday.” Greg watches his mother put dinner on the table. Manny is sitting at the table on his potty.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: You know, I read this really interesting article.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: (suspicious) You did?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah. About home-schooling. It sounds pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah. It’s a scientific fact that kids who are home-schooled get a better education than kids at regular schools. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 91.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Susan looks at him a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Is this about Rowley?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What? No, I just care about my education.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: No, you don’t. (then calls) Frank, Rodrick, dinner. Frank enters and sits at the table. He looks at Manny.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I just...what if he goes? What do we do then?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: We celebrate his achievement.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to Greg) Am I the only one who thinks this is weird? Rodrick joins them at the table and gleefully brandishes crumpled piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Hey, little brother, look what I found in the trash. Guess you threw it away by accident. Panicked, Greg tries to grab the paper, but Rodrick holds over his head and hands it to Susan. RODRICK (CONT’D) It's the invitation for the Mother/Son Sweetheart Dance. Know you don’t want to miss that. (mocking) Phew. Lucky I found it. Greg glares at Rodrick; Rodrick grins back at him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 183 184 185 186 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 92.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That was it; I was fed up. I'd been taking it from Rowley and taking it from Rodrick and taking it from everybody else. It was time for some payback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The din of Loded Diaper rehearsing in the basement can be heard. Manny is sitting on his potty eating a snack at th table. Greg enters, carrying the girlie mag from Rodrick’ room (Moto Mamas) and a big Tootsie Roll. He crosses to Rodrick’s backpack which is on the chair next to Manny an unzips it.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Okay Manny, I’m putting this Tootsie Roll in Rodrick’s backpack. It’s for Rodrick, not you, so don’t take it. Manny watches as Greg slips the Tootsie Roll into the pag of Moto Mamas magazine and puts it in Rodrick’s backpack. Greg exits smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan enters the kitchen with a basket full of laundry an stops cold when she sees Manny on the floor eating the Tootsie Roll and giggling at the picture of the bikini-cl girl straddling a motorcycle on Rodrick’s magazine.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Manny, where did you get that? Manny points to Rodrick’s backpack. At that moment Greg enters and innocently looks at the magazine.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Oh my goodness, that’s offensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan storms into the band’s rehearsal, followed by Greg is grinning and carrying Manny.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Rodrick, I need to talk to you. Upstairs, now.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Go ahead and talk. We’re a band, we have no secrets. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 186 187 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 93.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Fine. (brandishing magazine) What is this? Rodrick is immediately on the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: It’s not mine.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: It was in your backpack.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: No, it was in my room. (realizes he said too much) Ohh. Rodrick slumps down. Greg can barely contain his glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodrick sits in a chair, Susan paces in front of him. His bandmates are lined up on the couch, enjoying the show. G is leaning against the wall, arms crossed, savoring every glorious moment.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Did owning this magazine make you a better person?

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: No. Rodrick tries to ignore his bandmates’ snickers.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Did it make you more popular at school?

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Yes. (off Susan) No.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Do you have anything you want to say to women for having owned this offensive magazine? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 187 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 94,

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: (in agony) I’m sorry women. Rodrick’s bandmates burst into applause. He’s mortified.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You’re grounded. For two weeks. Rodrick shoots a glance at his bandmates. They look back him like, “Are you going to take that?” In a last ditch attempt to save face:

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: Okay, settle down. I think one week is plenty. Greg can’t believe Rodrick said that -- this is going bet than he ever dreamed.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Make it four weeks. And I’m going to need the keys to your van. All the blood drains from Rodrick’s face.

dialogues.speaker: RODRICK
dialogues.text: (a mortal blow) My van?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Do you have anymore smart comments? Silence from Rodrick.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, practice is over. Rodrick, you can go to your room. Rodrick can’t even look his bandmates in the eye as they out. Susan grabs Manny from Greg and marches up the stair behind them. As Rodrick sullenly heads out he glances at Greg, who looks back at him perhaps a little too innocent Rodrick mouths the words “YOU'RE SO DEAD” at Greg as he passes. Greg watches him exit, elated. He throws his fists into t air in victory.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yes! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 187 188 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 95.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks around, but realizes there’s no one there to sha the moment. His face falls, his arms slowly drop to his sides. He’s all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym is dark, lit only by a disco ball. It’s about hal full of parents and kids. There is a DJ spinning records nobody dances. In fact, everybody seems pretty uncomforta and awkward. Greg and Susan enter. Greg looks grim, dress in a suit jacket and slacks. Susan is dressed up, seems excited. Greg looks around and sees lots of kids from his class. He passes Archie Kelly who is being hassled by Quentin and his friend ARTHUR.

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: Hey, Bubby.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Where’s your bubby now, Bubby? They laugh. Greg nervously puts some distance between him and Archie.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Look at this place! Wow, it’s like a real disco. Want to dance?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (aghast) God no. Just then, Rowley and Collin enter with THEIR MOMS. They look like they’re having a great time. Susan watches Greg who watches Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Okay, enough already. Just go talk to him, fix it.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: He’s your best friend. And sometimes, when somebody's worth it, you just have to put yourself out there. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t even know what to say. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 188 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 96.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Invite him out for ice cream after the dance. Everybody likes ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I guess that’s not your worst idea ever.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Stop, I’m blushing. But she’s really pleased Greg is taking her advice. Greg sees Rowley is at the refreshments table getting punch. H takes a deep breath and crosses to him.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Hey, Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Hey. A beat of silence. In the background, Susan cranes her he to get a better look.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: So...you want to go get some ice cream after? Collin steps between them.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIN
dialogues.text: We already have plans.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (regretful) ...yeah, we do.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Fine. My mom wanted me to ask, so I did. Greg turns and heads back to Susan. As he approaches, she smiles at him expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Well? Greg just shakes his head “no.” Susan’s face falls.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. Well...oh. At that moment a new song starts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 188 189 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MUSIC CUE: “Groove Is In The Heart” by Deee-lite

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY LEADS HIS MOM ONTO THE EMPTY DANCE FLOOR AND THEY
dialogues.text: START TO DANCE. But they don’t just dance. They doa routine that they have clearly practised many times -- it right out of “Dancing With The Stars”. The crowd watches, mouths agape. Greg is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I couldn't believe what I was seeing. This is just the kind of thing I could have saved Rowley from doing if we were still friends. But now this fool was about to get himself killed. BUT THE CROWD STARTS TO GET INTO IT. A group of people surrounds Rowley and his mom, clapping and cheering them Other people start streaming onto the dance floor and dancing. The party is kicked into high gear. Rowley is now part of a whole group of kids, including Shelly, Marley and Collin, who are trying to learn his da Greg does not know a curse word bad enough to express wha he’s feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg is on the sport court, Rowley crosses to him. He has somewhat conciliatory air about him.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Hey. Greg senses a thaw in Rowley’s attitude.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: So...I left my racing game at your house and I’m having a sleepover so I need it back.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: What? No way. Finder’s keepers.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: You didn’t find it, I left it.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Fine, then leaver’s losers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 189 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 98.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: (getting heated) That’s not even a real thing.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It is if I say it is.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: It’s my game!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: You wouldn't even have that game if I hadn’t told you about it! You wouldn’t have half the stuff you have without me!

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, like a broken hand!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: That was a million years ago! Greg and Rowley are now shouting at each other. A CROWD, INCLUDING PATTY FARRELL, STARTS TO GATHER AROUND THEM. Gr and Rowley don’t notice.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: It clicks now! (bending wrist) Hear that? Click click click click! And it’s all your fault!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It was an ACCIDENT!

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: Fight! Fight! The crowd joins in. The noise gets the attention of Angie who is nearby on the grass reading a book.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Fight! Fight! Fight! This stops Greg and Rowley cold. They look around at the shouting kids.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (louder) Fight! Fight! Greg and Rowley are stuck. Greg puts up his dukes. Rowley does the same, then starts hopping around. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 189 190 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 99,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It’s clear neither has the faintest idea how to fight. An joins the crowd as Greg and Rowley start to half-heartedl circle each other. Just then there is a loud SQUEAL OF BRAKES. THE TEENS’ PICKUP TRUCK HAS PULLED UP AT THE CURB. Pete, Chris, Carter and Wade hop out and head toward Greg and Rowley. THE CROWD SCATTERS AND RUNS BACK INTO THE SCHOOL. Angie finds a spot behind a tree and looks on. Greg and Rowley start to run but the teens are too fast a grab them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley are being held by Wade and Carter as Pete paces in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I waited a long time for this.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You’re so freakin’ dead. Greg doesn’t love what they’re saying. But he’s really freaked out by the fact that THE CHEESE IS ONLY A FEW FEE AWAY. In fact, as Pete paces, he’s walking right by it.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You have no idea what we’re going to do to you.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Rowley, following Greg’s eye line, now sees the cheese an visibly blanches. Neither Greg nor Rowley can keep their eyes off it. Chris pulls Pete aside.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Dunno. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 190 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 100.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: We need to move this along. My shift at Applebee’s starts in like half an hour. Pete looks at Greg and Rowley...then he looks at what the looking at. Pete crosses to the cheese.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: (re: Rowley) Gimme the wide one. Carter hustles Rowley over to Pete.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Pick it up! Rowley reluctantly picks up the cheese. He holds it by th tips of his fingers, totally grossed out.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Now eat it. Rowley’s eyes widen in horror. He starts to bring the che closer to his mouth. CLOSE ON GREG: Greg winces, closing his eyes to block out the horror of what he is seeing.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don’t even want to say exactly what happened because if Rowley ever tries to run for President and someone finds out what these guys made him do, he won’t have a chance. So I’1l just put it this way. They made Rowley BLANK the cheese. Angie covers her eyes, aghast. Pete looks over at Greg.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Now you. Wade hustles Greg toward the cheese. Greg fights him the whole way. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 190 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 101.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: But...but...I’m allergic to dairy. Wade just ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! What are you doing on school property? The teens, Greg, and Rowley turn to see Coach Malone runn toward the sport court. Behind him, the kids from before trickle out of the school and cautiously begin to follow. Greg turns quickly to Rowley who is so traumatized by eat the cheese he seems to be having an out-of-body experienc COACH MALONE (CONT’D) Pete Hosey is that you? THE TEENS RUN TO THEIR TRUCK, JUMP IN AND PEEL OUT. With satisfied nod, Coach Malone hitches up his shorts and hea back inside. The rest of the kids regather around Greg an Rowley, including Angie.

dialogues.speaker: MARLEY
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: BRYCE
dialogues.text: What’d they want?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: What’d they do to you? Greg looks at Rowley who seems to be recovering slightly. Patty is near Rowley. She looks down at the place where t cheese used to be and sees that it’s gone. THERE IS A FAD OUTLINE OF WHERE THE CHEESE WAS. She looks around and see the cheese at Rowley’s feet. WITH A BIT OUT OF IT.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: Oh. My. God. Everyone falls silent. As one, they all look down at the cheese. Then they all look at Rowley. Rowley locks eyes with Greg. It’s all too much for him, his eyes well up wi tears.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: (to crowd) Rowley Jefferson ate -- At that moment, Greg steps forward and picks up the chees THE CROWD GASPS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 190 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 102.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I ate the cheese. THE CROWD GASPS AGAIN. Rowley stares at Greg in wonder. Angie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah. I ate it. And you know what, people? I just did you all a huge favor. Greg holds the cheese high, gathering steam.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I ate the cheese to show everyone how stupid this whole school is. The wrong friends, the wrong lunch table, the wrong butt, it’s all meaningless, just like this cheese. Anyone else who's sick of it, step forward and join me! Greg surveys the crowd confidently.

dialogues.speaker: CHEESE TOUCH
dialogues.text: OVERHEAD SHOT: The crowd scatters like a bomb went off, leaving Greg and Rowley alone again. Except for Angie who gives Greg an approving look.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: See you later, Heffley. She goes inside. Greg crosses to Rowley. They stand and look at each other Then:

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: So, you want to come over after school and...play? Rowley smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. They head off together.  191 192 193 194 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg walks down the hall with Rowley. Everybody gives the wide berth.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So now I officially have the Cheese Touch. But it’s not so bad. There are perks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg stands with Coach Malone. Nearby are a bunch of kids cowboy hats and vests.

dialogues.speaker: COACH MALONE
dialogues.text: Since nobody’1l hold your hand, I guess you’re excused from square dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley’s way is blocked by Quentin who has his b to them.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Move!

dialogues.speaker: QUENTIN
dialogues.text: What’d you say?! He turns around, ready to pound whoever said that. He see it’s Greg, shrinks away. Greg and Rowley pass by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rowley, carrying their lunch trays, cross to a t full of jocks.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Hey, fellas. He puts his tray on the table. Everyone at the table quic grabs their lunch trays and clears out. Greg, immensely pleased, smiles at Rowley.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: After you. They happily sit down to a civilized lunch.  195 196 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 104.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And I’m not the only one who had an exciting year. The Heffley family is eating breakfast. Manny is on the floor playing. Then he climbs up onto his potty. The fami watches; the air is thick with anticipation. Suddenly, TH SOUND OF PEE IN THE POTTY. Everybody cheers. Frank’s chee is half cheer, half wince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “June. Friday.” Greg, Rowley, and Angie are having lunch at their own tab PATTY APROACHES, HANDING OUT YEARBOOKS. She gives one to Angie.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: Here’s your yearbook. You’re not in it that much, maybe try to get out there a little next year.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: (gently) One day, Patty, middle school will end and become high school. And after that, it just becomes life. And all the things you think are important now, won’t be anymore.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: (confused, thus snotty) You wish. Angie heads off. Patty hands a yearbook to Rowley. Greg holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As if. She puts Greg’s yearbook on the table.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Handing it to you is like touching you. And I’m way too smart to touch somebody who ate the cheese. She puts her hand on Rowley’s shoulder. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 196 197 DIARY OF A WIMPY KID 1/22/09 - 2nd Studio Draft 105.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right, Rowley?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yep, you’re too smart for me, Patty. Rowley is trying really hard not to laugh. Patty sashays off. Greg and Rowley look at each other, then crack up.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, the yearbook was pretty much the Rowley Jefferson show. We see Rowley’s pictures are all over it. On the Safety Patrol page, the Wrestling Team page, in the candids sect holding up his arm in its cast.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And I don’t even want to talk about the Class Favorites page. We flip to the Class Favorites page and see ROWLEY HAS BE VOTED CLASS CLOWN. The yearbook closes. PULL BACK TO REVE GREG IS HOLDING THE BOOK, IN FRONT OF A WHITE BACKGROUND. Greg addresses the camera.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But it’s okay. It’s actually much cooler to keep a low profile. Who needs to be famous? ROWLEY PEEKS IN AT THE EDGE OF THE WHITE SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLEY
dialogues.text: Zoo Wee Mama!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: And if Rowley ever gets too big for his britches, I’1l just remind him who really ate the cheese. FADE OUT.
